_IGaGflxaRCK4FYnRsXjaw.text: Food and Service is top notch!!!! Best Sushi spot I have ever been to! Ask for Ray as your waiter, he is phenomenal! This will definitely be our go too Sushi spot for now on!   So my review is fair the food coming to our table was a little slow towards the end but Ray made sure we knew what was going on and advocated in the kitchen for us. $145.00 for four people with all you can eat sushi and desert plus 4 sake bombs a sapporo and a large hot sake.  Update 4-13-2015 Sad Ray no longer works there. Food is still great and the new waitress was nice, but just average, not fun like Ray!

R5G8Uzxma270zOaiWyX5aA.text: Really great quality fish and staff is awesome.

p4nApy9fU4I9cnNHF34jSA.text: I've been a customer of Oyshi for some time now. This is the newest location. The ambience was agreeable- it's spacious unlike other places with an open floor for general seating. Along the side were tables to accommodate larger groups and booths for added comfort. I was impressed with their design for the outer tables. They were more secluded but not completely shut off from then general population for privacy. For this review, I will based if off the last time I went for my younger brothers birthday. We had about 15 people. It was easy to make reservations and they had given us their largest table in the back which was a more intimate setting which I liked given the size of our group. The service was on point. Our server (who I forgot his name) would check up on us from time to time where I didn't need to go looking for him. I appreciate that. He did have two others who assisted him with out addition orders/refills. They were very accommodating to our group, given I bought a cake and they provided us with all that we needed.  The quality of the food was great both the sushi and meat. AYCE sushi and all types of steak? Hell yea!  The only thing I need to address is the quality of one of their desserts that originally when the company opened up was to die for at least for me. Their parfait dessert is ridiculous now. It needs to either be taken off the menu or don't call it a parfait at all. Majority of it is ice cream then there's a few pieces of fruit which I can count, syrup and whip cream. It would be great if they brought back how they originally made it. My family and I love eating here and we will be coming back when the cravings take over. Overall, Oyshi is one of my family and I's top sushi places to go to! A must try!

vEl22KeLNs9XmbelTib_UQ.text: Good food. Service absolutely horrible. Didn't bring refills when asked repeatedly. Forgot food.  I will no longer come to this location EVER again. The one on rainbow is amazing.

Npp0Zk3ovG1pak31Rr0BWA.text: Really nice and fancy atmosphere inside. Foods are so fresh and good.  But the place is too big so servers seem hard to take care of all customers when it gets busy.

CknVJMCJ8oj97CXgh-0p1A.text: Love their sushi lunch special, miso soup, and house salad! Great service and prices too.

sgimhd7_X7NJD_-9BrXySA.text: Here we are again..... pretty much one of my most favorite Sushi buffet restaurant that I can't get enough of! Brought our friends here for their first time and so far they're enjoying Oyshi Sushi. Again and again.... we'll for sure be back here!

Y3a7N8-9opdwH3pDM_Eo4w.text: Busy day and it seems like they're short handed? Bad service. We were told only 20 mins wait and it become 1 hour wait. Worst service. Didn't even get a refill for our drinks. Can't do half order and you can only order one dessert. Sushi don't taste good. Calamari was hard and cold. Employee don't know what the heck are they doing. NGiF4OG_5gphqLq2vGjX1A.text: Boom Boom!  Ate here for the first time. Came with a group of 11 people.  It was good that a room was available for us.  The all you can eat service was great.  The food just kept coming and coming.

GEjNRcAGySstk8LU3nAoDQ.text: This location has nice variety of sushi. From Rock and Roll to Monster Roll. This place has good flavor.  Chef Ed had helped us  at the sushi bar. He made my Father's time and mine a blast. He described all the ones that he had recommended to us and he did not disappoint. He was very helpful and kept the mood upbeat. Im sure that my father and I will definitely be back again.

BH6hCT1JIRA8LZ02P61WoQ.text: I've eaten at the other location, and liked it. But I tried this place, and I have JUST NOW recovered physically enough from the worst food poisoning I've ever heard of to write this review.  We got the all you can eat for a late dinner.  The sushi was fine, as far as I can remember.  I ordered oysters, two of them came in a little plate.  I slurped down the first one, and it tasted like a corpse soaked in brine.  Since I shoot raw oysters, it was already in, and I figured, what are the odds the second one will taste like that too?  MISTAKE.  I told my dining companions, "Wow these taste like they've been dead for a while..."  I forgot about it and moved on.  That night, my friend (who didn't have oysters) woke up around 1 or 2 am and puked.  She said she was fine the next day.  I was totally fine and figured her puny weakling stomach must've just not been able to handle the onslaught of all you can eat sushi.  I went about my day like a naive, unsuspecting fool.  Wednesday, around 4:00 pm.  In my office.  The rumblings of gastric distress started to bubble.  I had cooked my usual breakfast, and gotten a sandwich from my usual place.  I thought maybe the sandwich wasn't sitting right.  Within 20 minutes or so my vision started hazing, and my stomach started blowing up like that blueberry chick from willy wanka.  I felt nauseous.  Made it to my car and sped home, feeling sicker and sicker.  I bolted to my toilet and JUST made it in time as a violent torrent of vomit erupted from my face like a hurricane.  Violent wretching for several mintues, and then I slumped into my bed, exhausted.  However, there would be little sleep over the next 12 hours.  Every 10 to 15 minutes I would have explosive, violent, searing diaherrea like a poop volcano.  It started to feel dangerous after a full day of this, so I got myself to a hospital. I was diagnosed with a deadly food bacteria present in dirty seafood and prescribed antibiotics. As I got in my car to drive home I projectile vommitted in my car. I had to call a friend to take me home and pick up my meds. I was unable to get out of bed for a full 6 days, except to crawl on hands and knees to destroy my toilet every half hour or so.  Needless to say I will never eat here again.  I also can't see myself eating oysters ever again. Feeling thankful for modern medicine because this is the ish people die from.  NEVER FORGET. NEVER AGAIN.

xhsihq0hCzhaquRs54kRNA.text: The best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas  and this is coming from a sushi connoisseur. Even when it's packed they still have quick efficient service

wPd1WR10oMimqI6110E42Q.text: This was my second time going to oyshi sushi with my friends and I was very disappointed. The first time I went set somewhat high expectations. The first time the food was excellent, the atmosphere was amazing, the servers were friendly, but speed of service died a little toward the end because it was busy (which is understandable). When my friends and I went yesterday for the second time, the service was below average. Although the servers were really friendly, they constantly forgot about our food. We had to remind them at least 5 times. I could look over it, but it wasn't really busy which irritated me. It was such a let down. Going to have to reconsider coming here again.

K7he6iXRwv8twFWrwGm4Iw.text: Oyshi is one of my favorite sushi spots in las vegas. My favorite role is the oyshi roll and the Japanese lasagna also their Asian skirt steak is very good. They also have reasonable prices for all you can eat $22 for lunch and $27 for lunch

dHqCNKDzlYbAEGHVuT-NEA.text: Love this place. Best price, great quality, we come here often. I recommend the all you can eat all the way. It's the best in the city. I could eat here everyday.

iEWrO1oJzvuf3h4vGIDc3w.text: First off, it's dark in there. Like seriously, the only light that enters is through the tinted front glass doors. So you feel like you're in some cavernous spot, and when it's bright & sunny out it kinda feels weird. However, if you like that sort of thing, then have at it. Our Server, Rey, was pretty awesome! His energy & enthusiasm was the light in this cave. We ordered a few things then based off his suggestion, we ordered a different roll. Nice one too!  The Food Runner, I found myself helping him out. Like when we delivered the edamame, rather than attempting to place it in the middle of the table, he placed it off to my side, because there were a few things in the way. In my experience, yes I have worked in restaurants, when that happens, you set the dish down, make room, then place the dish in the center. However, that was his kind of thing, literally, just bring the food out. Didn't add to the experience, was just there. Oh but wait! The food! Yes, we did eat here. The sushi wasn't bad. For being our first time, and we only ordered 4 out of the tons of options! Again, I've had my share of sushi and the staple of a roll is the consistency of the rice. It has to be sticky. It has to hold it all together with the help of the seaweed. Well, flavor wise, the rolls were good. Like seriously. The rice was just meh. It wasn't terribly sticky. Some parts were a little brittle & dry. No, not the worst thing, just not the best. Now here's the AWESOME part. The have all you can sushi for $20! Yup! $20!! I can do and be experiencing this little feature for sure! Of course I'll be trying more sushi options for sure! Plus, what other way can you experience a spot with an all you can option??? It's on!

bk6ak0tG3CSFL6fa4Y9liQ.text: This is our fave sushi place ever! They got the freshest uni and delicious rolls! Love affair is so good. And of course their baked mussels are to die for. Green tea cream brulee is a must have. More expensive than the usual AYCE sushi places but so worth it

gbursIkcIUSCuuONvEXh4w.text: I live nearby and have read over the rave reviews, but only recently managed to make it in for Oyshi's AYCE lunch. The selection is large, with several sides and apps, as well as grilled dishes, to supplement the nigiri and (massive list of) sushi rolls.  Definitely ask about the daily specials to ensure you are trying their freshest fish available: the scallop, smoked salmon, conch, and mackerel on my visit were all incredible. Nigiri portions are generous with thick-cut large pieces.   Favorite rolls are the CHUNG HUA (salmon tempura and garlic yum yum spicy tuna inside topped with white fish and avocado, spicy ponzu and sesame oil sauces): it's spicy and has a great mix of flavors without being too heavy, really liked the sauces. This roll is nicely balanced out by the YELLOWTAIL TRIO (yellowtail chunks, cucumber, gobo, kaiwari topped with yellowtail sashimi dressed in ginger sauce), which is a lighter roll with the fish and fresh cucumber as the stars.   Standout apps include the sashimi salad, the vegetable tempura, and the miso soup (generous portion, lots of seaweed, and a savory-not-salty broth). The must-get orders for us include the Chung Hua roll above, a selection of nigiri, and incredible MACKEREL SPECIAL HANDROLLS, with gobo, kiwari, and cucumber.  Extra star for great service: Jesus is my favorite server f(rom another restaurant) and his attention to detail is unsurpassed. If you've never had a server recognize you across town and greet you by name, you might not understand. Jesus is the best, request him specifically if you are going for a special occasion or as a large group.

UmmXHDfhrYLZzIhOrEZHcQ.text: Tiger roll. Snow mountain. Rattlesnake. Kamikazee. Nuclear bomb. Best rolls I've ever had & all are found here. The menu is huge. There are so many rolls to choose from. This place got me addicted to sushi.

X5hEMPlIL8EOpDxNzOiRVQ.text: I came here with my family for the AYCE lunch deal. I think the food is okay. I ordered the lava roll, yakitori beef skewers, tempura, lobster fair, seaweed salad, baked mussels, and sizzling rib eye steak. Out of everything I ordered, the stand out would have to be the baked mussels. They were absolutely addicting. If I could, I would eat a whole plater of those mussels by myself. The lobster fair was indeed a great affair in my mouth. My brothers and I attacked the entire plate within seconds. The lava roll was good for a AYCE standard. However, I was pretty disappointed about the sizzling ribeye steak. It was rather dry and lackluster.  I wasn't fond of the customer service. It was pretty slow due to the lack of staff during, but I wouldn't blame them since it's Christmas Eve. The longer the wait, the more discouraged I felt to order more food. I've been to other AYCE Asian restaurants with better food and better service. Overall, a decent dining experience.

9gwhMg29SEjUlLKxOpCuEw.text: The locations a little off the strip but had a great experience here.  I'm a unni and oyster lover and was pleasantly surprised by its quality.  To top it off rhe service was excellent.  A great place to have sushi and some drinks.

U76TBlvNXVx1zpOqc1-7qQ.text: I am astonished by how friendly and knowledgeable the staff is.  I have had the most attentive and marvelous helpers. I would come back and recommend everyone come

xB0BSm9_9va-5lOhz057cw.text: Solid 4 stars for our first outing at Oyshi Sushi!  For a Holiday lunch in December, my family and some friends dined at the newer Oyshi Sushi on Sahara.  Our initial choice was Makino's (which isn't THAT bad) but we figure, "What the Hell?  Let's go try something new!"  Off to Oyshi it was!  On our weekend lunch the place wasn't overly busy thankfully.  Our party of 11 was seated in their more private party room towards the back of the restaurant.  Lovely decor!  Except when we looked at the HUGE mural in the party room and put it all together...it's a Japanese dude...somewhat naked!  Ha Ha Ha, but hey, at least it didn't faze us from some awesome eats.  Because we couldn't decide what to order from Oyshi's menu, the adults just ended up getting the all-you-can-eat.  And at $21 per person for lunch...it's a FRIGGIN' steal!  I mean, if you're gonna order more than one roll (which can average over $10 each easy) then this option is the way to go.  Also, if you're a sushi piggy like me it's the ONLY option!  You can guarantee each of the rolls I chose to try were in the upper price vicinity, probably around $12 per roll.    With Oyshi Sushi's all-you-can-eat menu you ALMOST get free range of the entire menu.  Most of the hot items and signature sushi rolls are available for you to order.  Only thing not on the all-you-can-eat?  Sashimi and sashimi with rice...of course.  But that's OK because there is so much to eat.  And eat we did!  I felt so bad for these folks because I just kept on ordering sushi roll after sushi roll.  With just the four folks in my family, we EASILY ordered at least 12 signature rolls!  Oinkers!  And that's not including the hot dishes we ordered of the menu!  You can see how getting the all-you-can-eat saves you a bunch of $ when you are an avid sushi eater.  I estimated our total without the all-you-can-eat option - I would have spent over $175, not including tax & tip!  Yowza!  OK, so this is just to show you some of the things we ordered off of the menu (and to show you how Fatty McGee we really are when it comes to sushi):  -Tiger Roll ($12) -Oyshi Roll ($13) -Love Affair ($13) -Dynamite Roll ($11) -Volcano ($10) -Lobster Fair ($13) -Rainbow Roll ($11) -Spider Roll ($9) -Red Dragon ($11) -Monster Roll ($14) -Premium Spider Roll ($12) -Ahi Poke ($7) -Tempura Shrimp ($7) -Yakitori Beef ($4) -Edamame ($5) -Potato Croquette ($4) -Gyoza ($5)  See what I mean??  We ordered all that (for just FOUR of us), and it doesn't include multiple orders of the same sushi roll!  Add that up right there and see the savings!  Save some money AND eat well!  How can you get any better than that!?  Quality = Good!  Sushi rolls were all made to order so they were cut fresh for us.  The fish was fresh that day, no fishy smells.  The sauces were kept on the light side which I appreciate because after a while everything starts tasting like eel sauce if you're not careful.  Sushi rolls were of a nice size as well, definitely bite size but not tiny at all in order to save them money.  Rice to fish ratio was on point and very generous.    At the end of the meal (which literally took us over TWO hours) you also get your choice of one dessert.  Only ONE you say?  Yep, and I have no problem with that.  By then you are most likely stuffed like a turkey after all that rice you've consumed.  So ending the meal with something light, like a Mochi Ice Cream, or a slice of Green Tiramisu?  No problem.  I'm already feeling bad since I think my family alone ripped you guys off!  Service for our party was great considering our party of 11 was taking up space and time.  Luckily our poor little Japanese server was up to the task of our large ordering shootout.  As a mention, parties of SIX or more are automatically charged 18% gratuity.  Boy did she earn it!  We actually tipped extra over the 18% to show how much we appreciated little her serving our entire party (seriously this dainty girl was no taller than 4 feet 11 inches).  We were eaters for sure!  Combining the other folks in our group, we easily ordered at the very least 25 sushi rolls.     Will I be back here again?  Yes, yes I will.  Oyshi!

Q5oE20GPpITSD_95uzZOYA.text: Bad food, rude server, dishonest practice. Most rolls taste the same as they covered everything with mayo. Oysters are sandy and not fresh, menu says you can order 2 per person but our party was restricted to one by the server. Only about 75% of the food we order showed up. The service was bad, waiting for water refill is at lease 30 mins. The worst of all, original check showed up on our table did not have 18% tips, but they charged on the credit card. When you sign the credit card slip, the slip says "pre tip" and asking you to tip again. I don't think anyone is managing the place as the busboy drop the dirty dish box on the floor, kicking the box across the dinning area. The wall painting was not family friendly. A man initiating sex to a woman who's butt is hanging out.

Yd954UOMEHDZDLugPGzFfg.text: Nothing special here. I've eaten here a few times and was somewhat satisfied with my meal but nothing to boast about. Servers have been decent and the atmosphere is just ok.

Qet-ttPOKKtHCgdN9rtNqA.text: My cousin brought me here while I was visiting Vegas. Currently, I live in the midwest in small-town USA with no real sushi in sight (unless you think imi-crab, mayo and a cucumber wrapped up in rice & seaweed is the bomb.com). After being deprived of fresh sushi for a year, this place was *heaven* (read that again in a sing-songy voice). So at first I wanted to rate this 5 stars but then I had to remember that I was raised in California and Hawaii, so I know a thing or two about quality sushi and quality fish. We both got the AYCE for dinner! Size-wise, the rolls were kinda small. However, the filling to rice ratio was spot on. Some of the rolls were packed full of fish with no crazy veggie fillers so that was pretty great. My favorites were the Lobster Fair (not spicy) and the Dragon Roll (a little spicy). I also got the "Maniac" one but that was way hotter than expected. The oysters were SO good. The shrimp tempura was okay. It was nice and hot, but the batter was really thick and heavy, not light like I'm used to. I love love loved the ocean salad they serve before your main courses come. My only disappointment was that when we ordered a second Lobster Fair towards the end of our meal, we could only eat 1/4 of it and I couldn't take the rest home. =( [It's probably a rule with the AYCE, which makes sense, but still, it was almost a whole roll!!!] We finished our meal with the creme brulee dessert. It's almost an amuse-bouche. You can finish it in about 2-3 bites. It doesn't really taste like like creme brulee though, it tastes more like a thick vanilla pudding with a carmelized sugar top that has a beautiful crack when you hit it with a spoon.

WFzbdgnosRmd_HaNnUd11w.text: Extensive menu, fast service, and delicious food. This place is an absolutely amazing choice for good sushi. The Oyshi on Rainbow was always my go to before, but I am so glad that they opened up a second location that is more convenient for me. The garlic albacore is a must.

dYmKLDysZ7z4R4ij-J16AQ.text: Used to be one of my favorite spots. Really disappointed in the service. Our food came before we even had a place setting or utensils etc, ordered all you can eat and our waitress only came around that first time to take our order. They are incapable of handling a busy crowd, I would highly recommend going to the rainbow location. I have given this particular location 3 tries hoping it would be better and they prove me wrong each time.

1gvO_ucovEKG-undVypDQQ.text: Amazing service from Kenny! Very friendly & funny. Treat Us very well! Thank you so much for your outstanding service! I will come back & definitely ask for Kenny as my server! Thank you!

P89vuAr6tJFa_6FBCfjhMA.text: At Oyshi right now and been waiting for my miso soup for easily 20 minutes. Terrible service already. Let's wait for the food and see how it taste. First time at Oyshi. Maybe last?

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My miso soup finally came after almost 25 minutes.

BypXUBadVCOH_WWaAxVCnQ.text: For all Oyshi lovers around the world , Oyshi is the place to be! Located on Sahara west of Rainbow . If you are a Vegas local or visiting overnight , come check out the freshest sushi in town.  Did I mention the prices during happy hour cannot be matched :)

Q6Cyigl8-YSPdSQYJZmONA.text: Amazing service! Kenny was the best! Very knowledge of the food made amazing recommendation! We will definitely be returning on a regular basis with service like Kenny! Thanks for the dope time!

63ksxye7EPuXJ9GiAunT4g.text: Would be 0 stars if I could.. came here for lunch right by my job. Order cali roll lunch special.. never got my soup or salad.. took 25 min for me to get my rolls are you serious for cali rolls.. then says well we have to charge you alacarte because you didn't get the soup salad... wtf I don't have time to wait for the soup salad it's lunch time I have to get back to work.. now your charging me more because you can't bring a soup and salad.. I was late coming back from lunch trying to speak with a manager over them trying to charge me more:.. will never come back here again

bSDyj0gc4xU9B1rK2ohEpg.text: My favorite sushi place! I never knew I could love sushi so much!  Their other location on Rainbow has the same quality food, but the Tenaya/Sahara location has much better service and friendlier servers!  We always get the AYCE sushi. My favorites are the Love Affair, the Kamikaze, and the Garlic Japanese Lasagna, yum! My wife loves the Salmon Lover roll.  The servers are super friendly and always come around to make small talk and jokes. We typically only order sushi but occasionally the servers will randomly send us appetizers to try and get us to branch out. There are also some secret unlisted menu items that they only offer to some people because of the limited availability... but you'll have to get to know the waiters first!  I seriously love this place. We come here almost every week, and love every minute of it.

gGrvMeO_hBIIBN1tMEp_og.text: We will be switching our sushi place for sure. This place was delicious and fast.   They have a lobster roll that was out of this world. Service was great and everyone was so helpful. Even the baked rolls didn't take too long to come out. They have a good lunch price which is also the happy hour price late night.....so perfect!!  Everyone was friendly and the place had a nice ambiance. We will be back for sure!!

mFo1IRt3EbR3JQMp3STY0Q.text: So happy my friend brought me to this place. For an AYCE place I actually Loved everything I ordered. From uni to rib eyes n everything in between...it was delicious. Great price, food, and especially the service. Definitely will be back n this place is highly recommended!

RP96_3GGPJDRgX-NgznbKQ.text: 1st timer.. Food is off the chain..  From Ahi Poke, Attomic Bomb, love affair.. I wasnt a sushi gal.  Coming back for sure for the food and service

Li0xJehsrpsW6kYm6yN5aA.text: I had ordered the sashimi dinner and a Japanese lasagna. The most disgusting sashimi I had ever tasted. If you want real good sashimi I would HIGHLY recommend Sushi Ko. THEY HAVE THE BEST SASHIMI!! Even though their prices are a bit higher than Oyshi Sushi, it is definitely worth it. And don't even get me started with the miso soup. It was so watery and had no flavor AT ALL. I had to throw most of my food away because it was that bad. Honestly a waste of my money.

onIO0kIwYi2mmKCzU44vzw.text: Came in pretty late and was sat right away! We tend to sit at the bar because my boyfriend likes to order half rolls. The chefs were very attentive as was our server. This is my go to spot and I recommend both locations to everyone! Very clean and super fast!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So delicious and very fresh! Thanks oyshi!

1BoZhJ_OsYK271oG-lp5Yw.text: Probably one of the best sushi places in town and I have sampled many places. The spicy tuna crunch had the perfect amount of crunch and spice.  The service was prompt and very friendly! Thinking of making this place a weekly stop!

po-Oe8M_-STIG-jhN5QebQ.text: I ate here with my family and I enjoyed it. The people here are great! The food is good. They have a lot of varieties to choose from. From sushi to Japanese food they have it. Plan on making this one of my favorite sushi bars to eat at.

dci2cjX09TbRQ20PuuhV6Q.text: This place is so good, the chefs really took care of us and the food was fresh and delish.

eu77-xezvAzBmKDJYR_RWA.text: I was there with my husband to celebrate his birthday today.  We came in and waited to be seated. There was a party ahead of us so we waited but asked a passing waiter if we could just head to the sushi bar and sit down. We were told to wait for the waitress to seat us. So we patiently stood around for about 10 minutes to be seated at the bar, at which there were four open seats. The waitress eventually came and seated the party ahead so we stood at the front desk for a bit. Behind us a couple came in, headed to the bar while indicating to that waitress, who waved back to go ahead, sitting in the two middle of the remaining available seats.  My husband and I looked at each other, then the waitress who then indicated they were a party of three and could not move a seat over to let us sit at the bar as well.   We stood there kind of shocked while the waitress then told us we could either sit at a table ( wouldn't be able to do half rolls which as just two people allows us to enjoy more different rolls) or sit at the separate alcohol bar (no bartender, away from the sushi chefs, kind of dark) or wait for one of the other couples to finish at the bar. We felt pretty slighted. We had stood there politely and waited our turn to be seated, only to have the remaining pairs of seats be taken by an INCOMPLETE party with no apology at all from the waitress. Just a kind of oh well you can wait or sit elsewhere.  It was pretty upsetting to have this happen, especially considering we came for my husbands birthday and wanted to do something nice.   We left. Had come before and enjoyed the food, which brought us back, but don't know if we will be returning for awhile. Seriously if I was able to give 0 star I could!

kjInGa8c4WUB9cZVaz9BGg.text: Worst service ever.  Just because we had a big party and gratuity is automatically on the bill, doesn't mean you treat the customers with the worst service. Where shall I begin. First it took us 30 minutes just to get water for a party of 15.  Second, when they bring out the orders they just place it on the corner of the table nearest to their entry and expect us to sort it out to whoever ordered it. Third, they just keep doing that and expect us to make room on the table instead of cleaning out our table which was a total mess because of all the empty plates on the table.  Did runners were rude. Just the worst I have ever seen compared to our other parties we had at sushi spots.  I feel our gratuity shouldn't have been automatically added after that service. Stay away from this place is you got a party.

Y6F-t7qnmPpeTgSKufpsvA.text: Awesome place to eat love the service and all u can eat sushi Great place to bring friends and always able to get seated

Ns6JusAAoAYnwuZQ9VYBmQ.text: Been here on multiple occasions. Food is always tasty and fresh. Service various from below average to above average depending on the day and the server. Sit at the Sushi bar instead of a table and your food will be much quicker.

BpwlQ3nBKrB5llPLYbLP0A.text: This is hands down my go to sushi spot. My best friend took me here for the first time 9 months ago and I've been here at least once a week ever since.   I love spicy rolls, some of my favorites are their: spicy tuna crunch, red dragon, and heart attack. For non-spicy rolls, my favorites are their: japanese lasagna, lobster fair, and teriyaki chicken roll. We enjoy their red snapper, yellowtail, octopus, salmon, and spicy tuna nigiri. Gyoza, steamed or fried is amazing too. I can go on, and on.  Every employee is incredible at what they do. Always smiling, refilling the waters, very friendly, and fast. The chefs, have great personalities!  Sometimes, I come for a girls night out or I bring my toddler. They are so sweet to my boy, giving him toys and making sure he's taken care of as well.  This sushi spot is all around INCREDIBLE.

5L1T_M7JfWwOKAF7z0zCWA.text: Is it cool that I like the interior design and art better than the food?  Just kidding.  I started out with miso soup and popcorn scallops.  The scallops were okay and it came with two sauces; some kinda mustard and I believe ranch.  Otherwise the fried scallops alone didn't have too much flavor or spice like wasabi batter or something.  Didn't meet my expectations but I dealt with it.  Eating it took me a while, but it gave me enough time to chat with Kat and her hubs about the restaurant ambience :P  This is the 3rd restaurant that I've found to have AYCE.  Nice foldable menu and good basic selections.  Salmon belly nigiri was good.  I found their fish to be on the dry side for the other nigiris as served.  Cool thing is their portions are bite size.  For my main roll I ordered the Love Affair... oooouuuu SO NOT sexyyyy either.  It looked like a mound of imitation crab mixed with crispies and lobster bits dumped on top of the cut rolls, hiding beneath the chaos.  But the flavor was good.  Nice that the restaurant has space for larger groups and separate dining areas.  The tall ceilings, creative wood designs, lighting, and paint art captured my attention the most.  Just to note too, walking into any Japanese restaurant I'm used to being greeted by the chefs or workers.  Here they have it modernly designed on the entrance wall - no joyous welcoming shouts...  Our waiter had a tiny misunderstanding with our separate tabs.  Also took a couple reminders for drink refills.  I shall end my review with a fair nod.  I might come back however it will not be my first choice for AYCE.  I wanted to have a taste of their green tea creme brulee.  Mission accomplished and I will say that their green tea creme brulee by itself is deserving of 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back seating design
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea creme brulee texture :D
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Larger party room art

iA5cfWqfawpyfoFHvsnv2g.text: For a while, my sushi squad (it's okay to laugh) were coming here weekly - yep, it's that good.   Oyshi is super clean, has a chill atmosphere and a friendly staff who are quite accomodating.   The menu is chock-full  of deliciousness - and you'll find something for everyone, even the non-adventurous. I love the nigiri here - perfect portion size. The ahi poke bowl is great, and I love that they've got it on the all you can eat menu, whereas most places will only permit one per person. We always get a ton of nigiri and a few of the skirt steaks, cuz they are a sizzling plate of yum that can't be resisted.   Chef Daniel was our absolute favorite, so you could count on us occupying a large booth in the back every Friday night. Since he has moved on, we hit this place up at least once per month - as some things have changed, which is a bummer - but it's overall still a great spot.   Room for improvement here would be the hot tea. They give you an entire pot (which is rad!) but because the tea leaves are left to steep, it's oftentimes incredibly bitter by the middle/end of the pot, which makes me sad.   You know we'll be back. Every other Friday for the rest of eternity :)

kFhVnpwIk2VELhJt7_Wo6w.text: When I come out to Vegas, it's gotta be Oyshi! Screw the buffet sushi and seafood... Oyshi is where it's at!  Peter, the manager was so accommodating to our party.  The waitress was attentive and courteous as well.    Some of my favorites were the Uni, the Korean galbi and all the fresh sushi and oysters.  Cannot be beat!!!  I can't wait to come out to Vegas again so I can enjoy another excellent meal at Oyshi!

uwPgVs_rcufA6YoHc5E5hA.text: AYCE is definitely the way to go. We had a party of five and we placed orders every 5 or so minutes. Had about 40 salmon belly nigiri,  5 plates of rib eye, 8 specialty rolls, oysters, different appetizers, dynamites... wish I can eat there every day haha..  One star taken off because appetizers were not consistent, the same plate can taste different on the next order. Tempura Shrimp was also meh ...overall good meal for the price. Service on the other hand was excellent.

uYfmKBX4tqYRcitnCdzULw.text: We went there last night   There was 10 empty seats at the bar and they made us wait to be seated.  After waiting 10 minutes in cramped lobby waiting to be seated we left.  This isn't the first time this happened however it will be the last time because this once loyal patrons will not return

IgxQVHFiVvryTLUbE42rgg.text: BEST SUSHI IN VEGAS BY FAR. Our family has been going here since it opened on Rainbow. Always has great service! shoutout to my boy Mikey!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Rock Roll

86LGZ5tPS0Jmhk1VtmhECw.text: Couldn't be happier with this restaurant.  Greeted quickly and requested a booth that they cleaned right away and were sat, ordered drinks and then the waiter, Ryan started making suggestions for food.  Since I'm veganish, I didnt want traditional sushi or the sauces containing fish and they had several items on the menu to order.   And I think I tried al of them.  The potato crustini I think it was called was incredible, like deep fired mashed potatoes! Order it without the sauce if your not a meat eater.  I also had the tempura fried veggies and tofu and a veggie "sushi" roll that seriously couldn't have been more happy with.  (See the pics within the post).  The place is clean, upscale modern decor, clean bathrooms and the food and drinks arrived quick!  Ryan repeatedly came back to make sure everything was good and if anything else was needed.  I've read some mixed reviews on here and have to say none of the things I read were my experience here.  Every place has off days and home run days, but I have to believe the way my experience went today is more the norm.  Highly recommend it and will definitely be coming back in the future.

Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of the tempura veggies and the fried tofu.  Couldn&#39;t wait and had to eat a few of the other veggies.

iiRxZqUUua46PIntV2nd4A.text: There isn't anything special about this all you can eat sushi joint compared to the other but I'll highlight some details.   They have happy hour Monday-Friday from 3:30-5:30 pm which is 20% off. Lunch is 22$ and dinner is 27$. The main detail I noticed on the menu that differs between the two is that dinner include one order of uni and other dishes... also all you can eat does not include sashimi too. Similarly to other ayce sushi place you can not share but it seems they allow some people in the same parties to not participate in the ayce options.  The staff is friendly and we came as a group so our order was completed slowly... it seems during the lunch time they only have two sushi chefs which cause the slowness but other sushi places seem that way too.   Wasn't too busy with us as a table and two other table being used. The environment is clean and the bathroom is well maintained.

r-KIDRlW5hoj47Y8D_Lyhg.text: Nice place, yummy food, they over do it on the rice for the sashimi on the AYCE and the fish size is marginally smaller than other spots I've visited. I also wish they would offer half rolls on the AYCE

CFssk1zEpIWO6M_tzpAtPw.text: Oyshi sushi came highly recommended from a buddy of mine back in Hawaii. He said the next time you're in Las Vegas you need to check out this place and that "I'll thank him later!" This place did not disappoint! This is hands-down now my favorite place for sushi here in Las Vegas!  There are ample parking in the strip mall. This is a very nice restaurant outside and inside. The restaurant is very elegant, spacious, with high ceilings. This location appears to be a new building so everything if fresh, new, clean ....  They have a very impressive array of sushi roll selections from your basic sashimi and nigiri sushi to their hand rolls and "signature" hand rolls! If you love sushi, I highly recommend ordering their signature hand rolls and other hand rolls!! Most of these selections are very exotic and unique! Nice combination and mixing of ingredients! The hand rolls were my favorites here!  Service is exceptional! They kept coming to see how we were doing, as well as making sure our drinks were topped off or didn't run low.  The next time you're in Las Vegas, take a drive away from the strip for some really fine hand-crafted sushi!  Oh, and did I forget to mention? Its all you can see for about $35! Even better! Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2txvBTIp1rpMO_wDY5m39g.text: Popped in for a quick lunch. I had the Tiger Roll which was really tasty. I also ordered edamame...and the order was pretty big so make sure you have someone to share with. :) I would come back here to try some other items. I like the ambiance as well, appropriate music and nicely decorated. Staff is friendly. Overall a good experience!

_xaVF1krAsuHre-sn0coCA.text: This place was a gem to find especially on Christmas Day! Andre our server was exceptional. He offered dishes of items I was craving which were crab and scallops. He did not disappoint as I ate everrrrrything.   Our waters never dipped below half and it came with lemons without asking. Desert was delish. I chose the creme brule which came with the $22 lunch menu.   Leave a review and receive a free beer on draft. Awesome ambiance, awesome service!!

0WuJF4Oc9PqFJmvz4zOPHw.text: This place has awesome sushi. I recommend getting the all-you-can-eat. Quality and fresh sushi that doesn't break the bank. When we were there, the chef made us a special flamin hot Cheetos roll. I don't usually order rolls, but this was pretty darn unique and good. Service was awesome and friendly. Definitely recommend this place. Will go back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K329oI71STLS4gb9RPf4Bg.text: AYCE dinner at $27. The sushi roll menu is extensive but I didn't even look at that section closely. Our strategy is always to get the nigiri sushi/appetizers/items that are limited - totally worth it then. What I like most about this place is that the fish is fresh. We ordered A LOT of salmon. I would skip the poke - it's mostly seaweed salad. Another highlight is that you can order sizzling plates of rib eye and other meats which were nicely portioned and tasty. Also got the medium house sake for only ~$12 which actually tasted fine and you get a good amount of shots when you're sharing it btw 2 people.   Our server was funny and quick with everything. He checked on us multiple times. This location is bigger than the one on Rainbow and we didn't have to wait for a table when we came in at 9 pm on a Saturday. There were plenty of open tables as well.

-gwlZFamvUd8-aaVoZJdeg.text: Only sushi I spend my money on! Love the Japanese Lasagna!

O7_dh6UlZGftbBzxF3-dqg.text: Amazing food, staff and management. This is our go-to sushi place. Reasonable prices and and a nice ambiance. Vine and Peter are amazing. Must visit!

BMm5jszYAmChW8gH_ndKEQ.text: Overall the food was good. Service was crappy and a lil over priced for how many times they forgot my food, didn't refill my water and didn't clean the table.

oqszTTH7Jku3YqQ_eWV1Uw.text: So my friend took me to this place after a tiring day back from Grand Canyon.  Service: from the moment we walked in, we were greeted by great customer service. Throughout our experience here, they were attentive, service was fast and amazing.  Food: Wasn't "blown away" by the food but it was pretty decent. The quality and preparation was awesome and some exceeded expectations. For example, the oysters were very clean and served just right! (And this is coming from the guy who doesn't like raw oysters) The sea urchin sushi was superb too. I was too hesitant that it would be too raw and gooey but it was rich creamy like half boiled egg yolk. Try the surf and turf too because the meat wasn't a brush off. It was soft and juicy, for the price that was paid for it, it definitely stands out. All the sushi and the rolls, had great rice to ingredient ratios as well so you don't have to worry about getting too much rice and not enough seafood.  Overall I'd give this a 3.5-4 Star experience!

tirgpLRg0kd0wMhgjCjkeA.text: The best al I found so far. Very fresh. Big pieces of fish. Appetizers are very tasty as well. We sat at the bar. Peter was very friendly and made great sushi. I would definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yuYXWGqnE7D-AhRd-Mj0Yw.text: Like the other Oyshi restaurnat, this one is amazing! Oyshi has the best sushi I have ever eaten anywhere in the world. That includes many countries in South East Asia. I recently went there for lunch for the first time and was reminded how good the food and service are. Whenver anyone from out of town comes to visit, I always take them to one the Oyshi restaurants. I have yet to take anyone there who didn't agree it was the best sushi they have ever eaten. Amazing place, great service, tons of roll options, and very reasonably priced.

DJ37Pn3d9weLP5W-KJUPRQ.text: Sunday sushi dinner! Decided to take some friends from out of town to our favorite sushi place! Excited we got our favorite server Golden! He is excellent. Always takes our orders promptly and remembers our favorite rolls. It definitely says a lot about the kind of service we receive here since it's always super busy and we still get special service. The rolls are always fresh and made perfectly! Our favorite rolls are the Japanese garlic lasagna, salmon sashimi, the Ian special, and the Lobster Fair. But honestly, anything you order is amazing! We recommend this place to everyone!!

mKQdQEIV0h9GVQtitnS9Jg.text: You guys can mark it this is my place to eat sushi it's really really tasty very good service it's very clean and very good environment go ahead and take your wife your boyfriend your girlfriend your husband and try it

ruGgFoMIA50sc-MhZlOcAw.text: Adding on to Cara N.'s review.  That server was awful, he really spoiled our nice sushi dinner.  Very unprofessional yelling in the restaurant and kitchen, swearing and he has the nerve to apologize for getting loud because it was a long day for him, no excuse!  He then tries to make conversation, but we were done! I'm very surprised none of the other workers stepped in to quiet him down.  Some of the other workers laughed at his antics but I could tell they were embarrassed.

Kr88OSZTfHhACWin8BgrrQ.text: Service was good. AYCE was worth the price, but they need to update the website, prices have increased.  Most everything was great, the one thing that was not perfect they acknowledged and asked if I wanted another one and they would let the chef know.    Kids AYCE is way overpriced.  Get there early on a weekend dinner, it gets busy and service gets slower.  Lots of staff to make sure your food gets out fast and freshly prepared.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atomic Bomb

ZyfNKJcQeCbugDCDqe5QVw.text: Tried this place since I'm not from Vegas but my boyfriend is , and he said it was a fav . I thought it was unique because I've never had AYCE sushi but coming to this place I thought it was worth . The place was really nice and clean , super spacious with nice decor . The staff was friendly and took their time with us when it came to ordering and making sure we were fine or if we needed stuff . The food was great , though the portions were small . Lots of rice on the rolls though , and they don't have much stuff when it comes to raw fish . Other than that , I thought this place was great and I would definitely come back when I'm in Vegas again !

-O6fv5Kwg-z35HH4lYdQbw.text: My husband and I have been here a number of times over the last 2 years.  It's  right a cross from the Smart Car dealership so we come anytime the car gets a tune up.  We have never done the AYCE but everything we have tried has been delicious!  Some of our favorites have been any of the baked roles, baked mussels and I'm a sucker for a good seaweed salad :-) The more traditional rolls are good as well and the service has greatly improved over our last few visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Skin hand roll

e_IVIvvvG43-Iog-D2jMUQ.text: Good food, but it takes toooooo long for food to be served. All you can eat is too expensive. The interior is nice and comfy.

9Yu5UbPF1BQdlCi9Kby1gg.text: *UPDATE* Man this place has been on a downhill slide. All the servers that were amazing are gone. Pedro, the best sushi chef in town, is the only person I recognize. Tonight was the final straw though. Waited 20 minutes to reorder and that was on top of the 10 we waited for the first round. Decided to pay the bill and leave. The server asked if we were in a rush, I said no but I'm over waiting for 20 minutes to order. Then he brushed us off with a, oh that must of been all my fault. Uh, ya it was. You served the table next to us and we had a table with all empty plates and drinks. When the owners asked if everything was ok, we told them what happened. Their response? Next time will be better. Lol nah, I'll be at Sushi Koma from now on. Bye!  Love this spot. Everyone is super cool even if you want to hang out for a while. They play good music and it's not crazy loud or packed like the first spot. I like the steak bites and hot tamale roll. Try to Japanese garlic lasagna too. If you like a lil spiciness ask for spicy maniac sauce. I dip everything in it! Don't forget to ask for Kenny! Best server in Las Vegas!

-0EigcmyWmMDkFctIVOU4A.text: My go to for AYCE sushi!! Such a great selection at a reasonable price. It's not just sushi on their AYCE menu but appetizers and dessert as well so go hungry! Beautiful location and good service. Their fish is good quality, not ridiculously fine quality of course but very good, and their rice is cooked well unlike most of the other more affordable sushi places in town.

Jpj8P72z7XgoDTjD1JhxSA.text: Their new location is in the space formerly occupied by Go Wild Sushi. Somehow they made the space less appealing. They tore out a row of booths and replaced them with tables. Also gone is the performance stage. The rest of the decor looks half finished. Luckily, their food is much better. A sampling of tuna, albacore, halibut, and yellowtail nigiri showed that their sushi is better than your average AYCE spot. An order of pork belly was good despite drowning in sauce. Rolls were fairly well crafter with minimal rice and ample fish. Each AYCE meal comes with one dessert. I opted for the velvety smooth chocolate creme brulee with its thick sugary crust.  A kid's menu is available. My kid's order of popcorn chicken filled a large bowl. As an a la carte item, it was an inexpensive deal that easily would have fed four kids. He ended his meal with a ice cream parfait made with vanilla ice cream, granola and chocolate and strawberry syrup.  3.5 Stars

TmsP8YhHrRDvs4yXH-EjTg.text: Experience:  a friend invited me to lunch, and this was the spot he picked. We met one other friend who mentioned their is another location she had frequented.   Facility: The restaurant was very nice with lots of unique accents and modern decor. They had both chair and tables and half booths with chairs too. The bar is pretty small and seats around 8-10.   Service:  It was very slow when we arrived, and it seems when restaurants are really slow, they tend to forget to check on their guests. They were friendly and helped when you asked, but I felt I had to flag them down too many times from their little congregation at the hostess booth. I'd give the service a 3 star rating.    Food:  the food was good. The $22 AYCE lunch does not include the sashimi, so that was a disappointment. They also don't serve oysters, uni or sweet shrimp for lunch. We ordered calamari, veggie tempura, spicy tuna roll, gyoza, seaweed salad, mussels, Cali salmon roll, snow mountain, a few other rolls they ordered I don't remember.  A special shout out to the dynamite, which actually had a teriyaki flavor, the Tempura shrimp, the atomic bomb roll, and this fabulous cucumber salad called sumomono, which was a nice palate cleanser.   Overall:  this was a pretty good lunch. Not my fav AYCE sushi place, but nice enough where I would come back with friends again.

VM5GD5HHLcHmZZjGTgfFjA.text: How this place has over 3 stars is beyond me. This was my second visit and it was horrible. The food was undercooked or miscooked. The bathrooms were atrocious. When I asked the server where the employees use the bathroom she said the ones where everyone else does. That wouldn't be an issue if there was soap in that bathroom. So these employees use the dirty bathroom then can't properly wash their hands then handle your food. Lovely. When I brought these issues to the servers attention and asked to speak to the manager, there isn't a manager there, she was sorry, made no adjustments for the food and walked off. $80 spent ok a place where the quality of food is not a concern and they aren't clean.

Ou--E3xAu6CSFO6NY-zWeg.text: I've been to the other Oyshi location, on Rainbow, a handful of times when a friend is in town...its her favorite sushi spot.  Saturday night was the first time I'd been to this location, and I'd definitely return again.  For starters, we were there with a rather large group, about 13 people for a birthday party.  We were seated in the far corner of the restaurant, in a private nook.  It was a really nice section.  I like the look of this location better than the other one...to me, its brighter, and seems a little less run down.  The server we had, I want to say he said that his name was Kenny?  I think it said "Golden" on his nametag..., anyway, he was spectacular.   Funny, friendly, triple checked on our orders.  He was really on it.    We were given a couple of "specialties" after we let Kenny know we were all having AYCE.  They brought out a ceviche, which I sadly, could not eat. (Avocado Allergy) Everyone else said it was delicious though.  They also brought out a Super White sashimi with a fried jalepeno on it, with an orgasm sauce (not sure if that's what they call it here, but that's what it was.).  This was really tasty. Super white is my favorite anyway, and the jalepeno was sweet with a nice kick.    As always, my husband and I ordered nigiri.   Most of what we ordered was pretty standard, but there were a couple standouts for me:  1.  The squid.  I've never eaten raw squid before; only grilled or fried.  I was anticipating a firm texture, like tako (octopus), but it was tender and delicious.  This was served with a piece of mint under the fish.  The flavor combination was out of this world.  A definite must have.  2. The Super White.  Tender.  Buttery.  Delicate... Pro tip:  Order the fresh wasabi and put some on this. (put some on everything you eat, but this one especially.)  HOLY flavor punch, Batman!  3. The halibut.  Incredible.  I've had halibut a few times, but this one was exceptional.  We really had a good experience here.  The reasons I'm only giving three stars are:  1.  They missed a few pieces of our orders.  Not a huge deal...but I REALLY wanted those oysters, and we didn't really have the opportunity to ask for them, since we ordered those towards the end of the meal, and our server was trying to get a bunch of separate checks organized.  2.  They charge for fresh wasabi.  One of my favorite spots does not charge extra for it, so this was a bummer.  We still got it, because a friend ordered it for us.  Its kind of a bummer to have your dinner budgeted and realize something you really love costs extra, when it doesn't at other places. Now that I know, if we return, we'll be better prepared.  3.  Their hot sake is bloody expensive.  $8 for a large hot house sake?  I'm used to paying $3-5 for a large bottle.   4.  At the end of the night, 3 drinks were brought out and only given to the front half of the table.  First of all...if you're only bringing 3 for us to share (since we didn't ask for them and were not charged for them)...you should probably do one for each section of the table so everyone can share a little bit of one.  Also, the drink was not made well.  It was a Moscow Mule, which is one of my favorites, and it was just not good.  WAY too much mint, not enough lime.   5.  My creme brulee was given to someone at the head of the table instead of me, so I got a half eaten creme brulee at the end of my meal.  (yes, part of that was the fault of the people I dined with, for not asking who ordered it...but if you wrote it down correctly, you should have just brought it to me.)    So...a good experience.  Service was MUCH better than the other location.  Other than the creme brulee thing, and missing my oysters, our server was really good.  People make mistakes, I'm not mad about it...but it does need to be stated.    The food was standard, but again...better than the other location.    I'd definitely come back.  It won't be my first choice, but I won't avoid it either.

_dYU-NULaivK2XQF8WGhmg.text: If you like sushi you'll love this place!  This is a gem! The prices are a little more than I'm use to coming from SoCal however the sushi is very fresh! Great flavors, a good selection and the ambiance is inviting. I've been here 2x and will continue coming here. They also have some out of the box desserts, the green tea creme brulee is decent. I'm a brulee geek so I hoped for something amazing it was so-so. Over all great place though!

J4cOjUsYFyOEu1eXMv1mXA.text: We can't decide if we want to call this place,  "Oyshi-No-No" or "Oy-She-Didn't"  ENVIRONMENT  Very large room divided into different areas. It seemingly looks good, but upon further inspection, it's clear that something isn't right -- dirty plates, strange Saran wrapped bottles at the bar.  FOOD The quality of fish is definitely low-brow. I believe we saw signs for all-you-can eat-options, so it's expected I suppose, but just don't get your hopes up.   SHOUT OUT The Volcano Roll comes Honey-boo-boo style.  SERVICE Horrible. The waiter always came to our table apologizing when he didn't do anything and that's when he actually came to our table. Please invest in training your staff, or continue to see these reviews about your service.   AFTERMATH It's probably best you go somewhere else if you know what I mean.

cGk13-tKmyyynu7heSOmWA.text: We love Oyshi! Originally familiar with the Southwest location, we decided to finally try the new location and as always we weren't disappointed.   We only go to AYCE - for dinner here it's $27 which honestly if you "shop around" you'll find is pretty much the same everywhere - if it's cheaper it's probably not a quality place lol   Service and food were great. Just a tip, Red Rock roll, Lobster fair and their Ribeye sizzling plates are to die for. If you're a crem brulee fan - they have chocolate edition :) the new location is slightly larger than southwest and the decor looks great! We'll be back for our next date night.

I8R5nrjHf3dYgydTFG_NmA.text: I was in the area waiting for an oil change and decided to try out a local restaurant. It seemed like a good day for Sushi, and perhaps it was a good day for sushi, just not at this establishment.   To start, I ordered some rolls as an appetizer and it only arrived AFTER I was done with my entree.   The yakisoba was decent but nothing to write home about.   The sushi's rice was completely flavorless, not even a slight tang of rice vinegar or anything, the rice had a tougher consistency like it had been sitting in a fridge.  The only upside is that it was pretty cheap, but not worth returning to.

8SVFRfq9sWBX4zMshB5I-A.text: This place is great for AYCE sushi!   The night we went they seemed to be understaffed so service was a bit slow, but our waitress Miranda made up for it. She was awesome (:   They have a large selection of different sushi and appetizers, I would definitely recommend their calamari and the egg roll. I wish I remembered the name of the sushi we got but they all tasted great. I did have trouble eating one of the rolls though because it was huge and it was hard to bite the seaweed wrap off the sushi, so it ended up falling apart. Regardless it still tasted really good. They also have really good mochi.  The guys who brought the sushi to us were very quiet though so it was hard to hear what exactly we were being served.   Overall we had a great experience here and would recommend it to sushi lovers!!

ZRDhvEtzECCrgpEWUMdRag.text: One of the best sushi places around. The food was delicious, and there's a wide selection of basically everything. lXCLqdBdCNnkbSxZED3MJw.text: Hostess had a horrible attitude. If the restaurant advertises that it is supposed to close at a certain time, they should stay True to it. My party walked in at 9:45pm when there were still about 5 tables in the restaurant. The restaurant is supposed to close at 11:00pm. The hostess with a look of disgust on her face says "we're closed" with no further explanation. Having this memory of this place will always leave a bitter taste in my mouth.  I've eaten here before and I can honestly say service is pretty bad and the food is not that amazing. The fish quality is poor and the food is far from special.  The oysters were enjoyable but are not on the AYCE menu.   SOHO on Jones is my go to Sushi spot in town! Xnrr4bLLFIUeihbL8aBnVg.text: I had been craving sushi for a hot minute and decided to order some sushi for dinner. I ordered 3 hand rolls and 3 orders of masago sushi. I had ordered and paid for my meal on postmates pickup and when I arrived I picked up my order. When I got home with my dinner I noticed this is what my 3 orders of Masago looked like. jrW5zSRwtrtSjix_D6eZIw.text: I'm a HUGE sushi guy. So much so that spending over $150 isn't out of the question for some legitimately good fish.  I came here at the suggestion of my friend who had previously enjoyed it. The decor is very hip and showed a strong traditional Japanese aesthetic. An eclectic mix of hip hop was playing in the background.   So far so good....  Now here's where things went down hill. My friend and I ordered our rolls and appetizers. Soon after the waitress left our waiter arrived with our edamame. I politely asked her if I could get an extra pair of chopsticks. It technically wasn't an extra pair as I never received a pair but no biggie right? Wrong! The server was rude and asked me if I was sure. As if I had reason to lie. Dude, I don't have utensils, who cares if I got a pair or not, give me an extra pair.   Apparently though asking me if I was sure wasn't enough. She looked under my menu and all over my plates to see if I hadn't "misplaced" my chopsticks. This left a bad taste in my mouth. It would have been more polite, expedient and professional to simply give me an extra pair. I swear I'm not stealing your sticks lady!  Another point that rubbed me the wrong way was the fact that in the 30+ minutes we were there I only got a refill on my drink during the last 3 minutes of our stay. That kind of sucked.   The food was ok. The mussels were pretty good. The reason I'm not knocking this place down to a 2 star review is because the food wasn't horrible ans because our original server, who I can only imagine 'sensed' we weren't having the best experience, tried her best to save the night. Too little, too late. Although I do appreciate the effort. You rocked.  Doubt I'll be back. If you want good AYCE sushi go to Goyemon. If you want really, really good a la carte sushi go to Yummy Sushi Grill off or lake mead and the 95.  Final word: exiting the restaurant i couldn't help but notice their B health rating. Now B isn't bad but an A is the standard and pretty much expected of any restaurant. If I could I'd give this place a 2.5/5.
