Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Salmon Eel Sushi

Oszw-XTs6QIzKOw60EBs5g.text: Not sure if it's the same owner or management but its usually our go to sushi place when we have a night out from the kids. The place seemed run down not as clean as it usually is a few months back.  We walked in around 5 and it wasn't busy but as we walked to our booth literally every empty table we passed had a handful of crumbs that needed to be wiped down. When we got to our booth there was a good amount of crumbles that we wiped off our seat and spilled soy sauce on the table we had to clean before sitting.  Miso soup was overly salty as if they dropped 2 packages of miso soup in 1 serving water?? Our cucumber on our salad was very rubbery and transparent (old cucumber that was left in water for awhile .. not fresh at all)  Seeing the minor set backs we didn't choose AYCE instead we went with a few basic rolls & had the waiter suggest and pick one of the best.  Spicy Tuna was overly spicy and we like spicy but this was just way to hot!  California roll had way to much crab a SUPER small amount of avocado and 1 layer of rice I could literally count the amount of rice rolled on the seaweed.  My husband had sushi with raw fish both inside and on top which was a greyish brown color. We both looked at each other like WTH is that bc it smelled a-bit weird. Chicken teriyaki was boiled chicken with no seasoning with a watered down soy sauce layered on after it was boiled.  We ended up leaving not finishing ANYTHING we order and went to Sushi-mon which is across the street!  As we left .. again there were a lot of messy tables but 3 associates talking and laughing near the door. Very sad because this was such a good go to for good food, but this was our first ever sushi place that we left not wanting more!

W8ZbPHkisaAphru0FAvWTg.text: Service was very slow. I know sushi takes time, but if I have to wave the busser down more then once cause the server didn't pay attention to us then I wouldn't have given them a bad review. There other location on Rainbow is way better. The quality isn't bad, but the service is a bit terrible.

8ylH3Yk5qq43NV6y2XjWDw.text: My first and last time. Service was awful. Busboy/server I guess doesn't know what he bring out to use. I really wish I would of took pic of how all the wasabi and ginger was brought to the table . 3 people spent 107$ all you can eat lunch and 1 all you can eat dinner we picked at almost every thing from the menu just to get are $$ worth. Had to ask server and busboy to clear the dishes off are table. Had to wave server down for service. It was not busy. I love sushi so much but I don't recommend this spot at all. Can't even get shashimi with a 25$ all you can eat only rolls. Worst experience in a while for sushi.

m3dYCw3MhSL2D7Ymk5BPFQ.text: Stated Simply - Amazing Place.  Over the past few years I've been coming here and it has certainly become my favorite spot. Wait staff is friendly, Chefs know what they're doing, everyone knows their jobs well, and makes you feel like you're cared about.  Literally every sushi chef is personable and remembers your tastes after you've been in a few times.  Management actually cares and is quite approachable with any issues you might have. Pretty great environment on the front end of the business. Now, the food. Literally the best quality AYCE I've had. Not sure if it's straight quality or if it's the competency of the chefs to add to it, but man do they serve some amazing plates. With pricing under $30 per head it's hard to ever pick a different place to go out to dinner together.  Great value for the price. Great service. Great food. Above all, it's consistently good. Not much more to say. Thank you to management, chefs, and staff. Keep it up.

XEN9sw9VimrTxUUMDEXEMw.text: Second time coming to this location after a fairly good experience the last time we came when we were in Las Vegas. The website and Yelp both say this location closes at 11pm so we went in for a late dinner at about 9pm. The restaurant was noticeably less crowded than the last time we were there but we were seated right away. Our waitress was good and quickly came by and took our orders. The first round of food came out quickly, everything was good except the uni which was definitely bad.   The restaurant started to thin out and eventually we were the only table left. I have worked restaurants for a long time so I get it, I know what it is like to be over it and want to go home. However, there is a level of professionalism that is expected when you have any customers around. My parents ordered a couple of hand rolls, etc for their last round and was definitely falling apart and literally thrown on the plate.   The biggest issue for me was one of the other employees (not our server). Before 10pm the rest of the workers were already cleaning up and talking to the other employees, no big deal I get it. However, one of the employees was incredibly unprofessional. Literally yelling (again we were the only table in the restaurant), cussing every other word, I literally heard him at one point YELL "Oh fuck ya, when her fucking titties were hanging out!" I am far from a prude but I was literally there with my parents who are obviously older and do not tolerate that kind of stuff. My mom was mortified, that employee did  come by our table with a half-ass "sorry for being loud, it's been a long day" while literally laughing. We were all over it and just wanted to get out of there. When we left not a single employee said thank you, good night, anything.   I would definitely recommend going to their other location or just trying another AYCE sushi spot.

nAI2rvalE-mBntL6W4NuWQ.text: Our server Ryan was the best! Thank you. Uni was on point and he also catered to our guest that had a shell fish allergy! Hands down good food !

-Y-1F0bDYjrbaRYgG_Mwsg.text: I hate saying the word "date".  I prefer meet & greet. He was already seated at a table but I preferred the bar as usual when I'm in Sashimi mode.  Cool, noisy place, lots of energy!  Spacious table setting for groups and can be romantic.  The waiter was so attentive!  The chef I think was eavesdropping at our conversation lol I ordered a big bottle of sake then seaweed salad - EXCELLENT - usually I share so I have room for the real stuff. To die for sashimi platter  - red snapper, albacore ( wished they had Blue Fin), Spanish Mackerel.  Nice almost perfect sliced pieces. Lots of interesting conversation in between...more Sake.  Finally I offered sake to the Chef which I often do when I'm seated at the bar solo. He accepted and we toasted Kampai. The Piece de resistance to top off my already overstuffed belly - Unagi w avocado hand roll - moist not drenched in sauce.  Not too sweet and seaweed wrap just perfect & crisp for biting into!   I walked away with one of the best meals & company I've had in a long time!  Go and experience it for yourself!

DU-LaaBmeu5cjlpUJQWSgg.text: Solid 4 stars would be appropriate if everything was like usual; least that's what I'd presume taking everyone else's rating. Unfortunately, today wasn't like any other day. It was a very special day. When we walked in, four chefs and three waitress welcomed us. We ordered a beer, two miso soup, one ahi salad, one tempura, one pork belly, one mussel, six orders of sushi, and one roll. Yes we must have ordered a lot because it took them twenty minutes to come back to the table to check on us another twenty minutes to take the second order, another twenty minutes to tell us that our order will come out in no time. ..... we gave up on waiting and asked for the check. Waitress was still nice and polite but the speed of food was no where close to four stars... more like one star. .. nice waitress made it two stars.... manager was on duty, calling and talking with someone important. I'm sure they wouldn't want me back there because I ordered a lot, but I'd never recommend this place regardless....

BiaW32GMmz784Uc3vQfZ6w.text: I've the all you can eat sushi at oyshi.  This location is just as yummy as the location on Rainbow.  I recommend that you sit at the sushi bar for the best experience.  This is a great way to get good recommendations from the sushi chefs.

Xon6oC-oTTltvLySY1E8Ew.text: Ate today 1/10/16 at lunch with Chef Eth (sp?). AMAZING! My absolute favorite sushi spot. Clean, fresh fish and great service. Chef Eth went above and beyond and created sushi for me that was not on the menu, and everything came out beautifully, artistically, and delicious. Best sushi in Vegas. Thank you, Oyshi!!

3fvpyD_hO6T8mkVlKhqkGw.text: Just awful sushi. Mostly tried nigiri. The rice was not seasoned correctly. The fish was dry. The uni was grey. They served the eel with eel sauce on the same plate as other sushi getting the eel sauce onto the other nigiri. Multiple orders of appetizers failed to arrive. Service was slow.

xqNRNN2w__xw6els8wYptQ.text: This place has wonderful sushi! You order, they make it and it comes straight to the table. They have alot of good rolls and tons to choose from. Plus their all you can eat isn't super pricy and everything on the menu is included except sashimi. The only problem with the all you can eat is it is regular sized rolls so its worth it if your a big eater. I only made it to two rolls but my husband had at least 8! The service was really freindly as well. I will be going back next time we go out for sushi.

0dJTK8zcQ6ifmMTM4VCSCQ.text: Service not friendly. Instead of greeting us when we came in, they told us they were closing in an hour. Fish was not fresh. Spicy tuna roll had an off fishy taste. Asked for no sauce on roll, but roll came with sauce. Overall was disappointed, would not recommend and will not go back. We only went there because our favorite sushi spot,soho, was not open.

rUmGKougnwsM34SNWODELw.text: Loved this location! Food was tasty and service was on point. I liked this location better than the original.

nT_ZNeRzyQKQXq8vlmEtTg.text: i love this place i highly recomended the bento box is awesome the service is awesome.!!!

uPondkMmenR9ZeShp7B4VA.text: Thought we would finally try out Oyshi since we were in the area and had heard such great reviews. Upon entering the place was fairly quiet with the exception of a screaming child, no big deal, and the normal chatter of customers. We came in around 1 on a Saturday and it wasn't very busy and we were seated right away. We put in an order for the AYCE almost immediately and began waiting. It was nearly 25 minutes before we received our first things, we were told the kitchen was backed up, yet when we got our food the calamari was cold, flavorless, and rubbery. My baked roll was cold. When I asked the server if it was supposed to be at least warm, I was given the run around and he finally said it had been sitting while waiting for the other things to finish and that he could get me a new one but it'd be another 20 minutes! I agree and when 20 minutes came it was just as cold as the first time. The manager didn't seem to care and almost everyone else was getting their food in a timely manner except for us. In total we ordered 5 rolls and 1 appetizer (3 of the rolls and the appetizer being ordered in the first 5 minutes of being there) and that was in the span of an hour and a half. even after all that we were given a half ass sorry from the manager and still paid full price. This place is completely over rated and I will stick with a different sushi restaurant that is more reliable and friendly. Too bad because the place was nicely decorated but that's about as far as it went.

ko9FXKrSnj78yfLhkWm4bg.text: Love coming to this place especially when the server Kenny is there ! Best service ever when he's there .

-QdQstBXNSg2h101jVWDDg.text: Never written a review before but this was just ridiculous.. Had been to this location multiple times and always had pretty good service. On a Wednesday night we did AYCE we were here for over 2 1/2 hours because of absolutely awful service(I actually took a 15-20min nap at the table and still nothing had changed)! Multiple times we waited over an hour for food, the times we got food it was the food runner throwing random stuff we didn't want or order and she would ignore us and run off before we could say anything. Table was never cleared until almost 2 hours in. Had to get up at times and get someone to help us so we could get refills on water or put in an order for more food we would have to wait forever for. Then after all this the manager didn't even care! Just said sorry very unapologetically and had to almost argue to get a discount on the meal that we most definitely deserved. Very disappointing. I had always liked this place and now I don't know if I will ever eat here again because of this experience which sucks because the food is always good :/

U5WCjbprnUAzEo1JrxCA_g.text: Agree with several who have commented already, the service was horrible at best. The waitress barely looked at us when she spoke, kept calling my wife and I "you guys" and did not listen to our answers when she asked a question. Also no half rolls disappointing. No comparison to Yama Sushi or a couple of other places that we often frequent. Would not recommend the all you can eat as with opinion is not a good value at this restaurant. Perhaps if sitting at the Sushi bar the service would be better.  Might add; have had the pleasure of enjoying Sushi around the world, not just various locations in the US and VEGAS in particular. Doesn't make me an expert by any means, but perhaps a little more adept on determining what I expect. Whether it be Japan, Korea, Europe, Guam, Hawaii, Taiwan, or here in the US, service is service and quality is the same expectation regardless. If a restaurant wants to be great, they have to be consistent.

ef02DZ03TIG4Dmy3h3E4Jg.text: Became violently ill after eating here, barely enough time to make it home. Friendly, efficient service. Lots of young people in trucker hats and beanies. Not a lot of asian dinners. Sashimi/rolls tasted odd. Just kind of shrugged it off. Win some lose some when it comes to AYCE sushi.

0JVmoHwvWBYHocK9tcNTFw.text: Some of the best rolls in town Always amazing! We came back for lunch!! We just ate it last night!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sdEnwZGKJVNfPeQl-1rUTQ.text: The original Oyshi is my fav sushi spot but we love out on the reservation and it's just so very far! I was very excited when this location opened! We couldn't wait to go and we were NOT disappointed!! The prices are lower- The ambiance is clean and classy- The music was 90's pop and at perfect volume- The staff were all so polite and helpful making selections. The only reason I didn't give a full 5 stars is because they don't offer half rolls. My husband doesn't like a lot of the raw rolls that I order and it's too much for me to share his baked rolls. All in all... It was delicious and we will DEFINITELY be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Redrock Roll- my fav!!

7R9gexagfEGN0QRfWNtx8w.text: Came in on a Friday afternoon with some friends for some drinks and sushi. It's January 1 and surprisingly not busy. Despite of having a few customers, we still had to wait a long time for food. On top of that I also ordered a bottle of Asahi and sake. It took them 45 min to serve drinks that suppose to be the easiest thing to do. I've eaten here before and the service was way different from what I experienced. Really disappointed in the overall outcome of dining here. I couldn't give the place a half a star for some reason so I settled with one.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I guess they have a new item on the menu baked mussels with a side of sausage links

H5EREDvWlJaLERtMAuD8sw.text: Since someone reached out and responded to my post, I decided to update my review. My one star was an accumulation between the food and the service I received. If I subtract your server's hesitation, then I'll give it three stars.

tzoaIKpWIUVQQZDmhorEeg.text: I moved out of town a few years ago and make sure I go to Oyshi w my twin and make sure it is A day Kevin is there! Great food! Great people!! Worth the trip every time! Thank you!

Rd-Ow8cw2gPtjSBRTW_82g.text: Pretty place, clean and good service. Their baked rolls are really good. I would recommend to try

Z5iPLeGb2VBfHqvzmQ2jPg.text: Went on a Sunday night about 8:30pm.  Tried to go to Sushi Goymon first but there was a 2 hour wait, so decided to venture over to Oyshi Sushi.    When we arrived the place was half full, but still seemed overwhelmed, dirty dishes piled on empty tables with hostess clearing tables, waited about 5 minutes before she was able to seat us.  Not a big problem, but should've taken it as a sign of things to come.    We ordered some hot tea which came luke warm which got us off to a bad start.  The sushi, dragon rolls, caterpillar roll, tuna, were all fine, but took about 20 minutes to arrive.  We also ordered salads which came AFTER yes after the sushi about 30 minutes later.  When I mentioned this to the waiter, he simply said that we have two different kitchens and we bring things when they are ready.    Overall, it sushi was ok, probably 3 stars, but service was lacking so minus a star.  Probably would not go back.

9jNUFyroRBx2_Qlv6NlcAw.text: We visited the place last night. The restaurant is nice and spacious and the host greeted us well when we walked in. I was immediately disappointed though when I was told hamachi isn't part of the AYCE. Other places offer them with limit one per customer. The waiter was okay, not too friendly. He asked for our drinks and gave us time to think about our first order. We didn't get our own plates though until we asked for it after appetizers. I would think that should be automatic along with the ginger and wasabi on a japanese restaurant.

CC2V_rA_Ejg5usG4uEWsWA.text: Fish is so so. Had 5 different kinds. They all taste the same.  Im a pro at eating sashimi having been to Japan numerous time.  This place is fine for an American palette.

P3lwl3a59g0-z4LCc4pqtA.text: I went there last night with my family and a friend for my wife's birthday. Ryan, our waiter, was very honest and friendly. He did everything he could to make sure our experience was as pleasant as possible and did a great job. We would definitely be coming back  The food quality was excellent, especially the shrimp tempura Yum!

K9KCcRfka7Mn-8U_cO1bQA.text: Let's just all come clean, we all cave to the All-You-Can-Eat Sushi temptress.  And Oyshi has one of the best in town.  The food is phenomenal with awesome custom rolls. The lobster roll is ridiculous!  This is our go-to sushi spot now.  The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is that it's kind of cold there.  Now that I think of it, every sushi place in town is.  Why is this?  It's not like Japan is in the Arctic or something!? I would give anything to have a sushi joint in a comfortable environment.  However, in the case of Oyshi, the food is good enough to wrap up and brave the winter storm.

ZOgrhHXewb3aLNaIYceJrg.text: It was ok, not as fresh as I would like, service was moderate, everything needed to be cleaned, from the menu, table chairs to the floor, the  level of excellence needed to come up for a sushi house.

Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni

tvPZIkNTVNpxxCwFKVi8Pg.text: Been here twice & have loved it ! The service is awesome & so is the food. Waitress are helpful in ordering different kind of rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ypPz8qrr5oldcwsQ37OTnw.text: Second of their restaurants. Great staff. Outstanding sushi and other fare. Really. A fun spot for dining!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E3_AecTljtb4iFRj_7zxyA.text: Came here for lunch with my daughter... First of all, we received shitty service from the server and chef... took 10-15 minutes for her to stop by to refill our drinks, and retake our orders everytime, we were in there from 330p-530p cuz of slow service, and it wasn't even busy... Second, either the chef doesn't know the menu or he just thought that I was too stupid to know the ingredients in the rolls I ordered cuz I ordered a heart attack roll and the menu says there's yum yum soft shell crab mix inside, I watched him make it and he put regular crab mix inside, I confronted him about it and he denied it and said he did put the soft shell crab mix in it, even though it wasn't cuz there was no soft shell crab in it... Also i ordered seared mackeral nigiri and he served it to me cold, he didn't even sear it... Not to mention they give u small cuts of fish... And 3rd, the worst part about this place... They had flies in their sushi case shittin all over their fish, I didn't even notice em til my daughter showed me... They leave their sushi cases wide open even while they're just standing there with no orders, everyone knows ur supposed to close the sushi cases when ur not using em to prevent that from happening, and to keep the fish as cold as possible, but they just didn't give a shit, I can almost guarantee they're running a dirty kitchen too...Never coming back to this place again..

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flies all in their sushi case... Here&#39;s one of em shittin all over the tuna..

2n-c1m8Yhx2X0O-wpEExWQ.text: I come here a lot with bae. I love it. Monster roll is really good.  They also give free beer if you review on yelp!

pSvsEe_hES-4Zjcltl5Daw.text: This sushi place is my favorite! This is the newer location they have opened. It's clean, beautifully designed and decorated, and our server Kenny was amazing! Very attentive and polite. The food and drinks were also great! They didn't have a whiskey sour on the drink menu, but the bartender was kind enough to make it for me anyways! :) All in all recommend this location!

C8aXTajEvwOjBPFppvizhg.text: They say the gems are found outside the strip and this is def a Gem for the locals. All you can eat fresh suchi and menu..... Oh man. Delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A.U.C.E AWSOME

u3C7a5ztZd2xNeSXP6UH5w.text: Sushi was okay. The rolls looked messy and the service not the best but our waitress was nice and helpful. The music was to loud and made having a conversation with my husband hard, not to mention we couldn't hear the wait staff. I would go again but not for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caterpillar roll with to much eel sauce.
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dragon and Monster roll

_ois9fQQwfJfgd57S2neTw.text: First off! Ask to be sat in Ryan's section! My husband and I have never had a server with so much personality, so kind and made sure everything was perfect and we had everything we needed. Please, if he makes a suggestion then take it! He let us know about an item not on the menu. The burger and fries roll was phenomenal! As for the food. We tried the rainbow location and the food was good but I think the service at the Sarah location made our experience really stand out!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5cXFn692VU8_mWGZF7LBCA.text: Why so fancy?!  So my wife and I were driving one day, trying to figure out how we can top off our empty stomachs when we saw this gem from the streets. Located in a plaza on Sahara off of Teneya, this spot had a clean look to it. Plenty of parking. Walked inside and almost felt as if I was under dressed. This place is Fancy. Greeted as we entered, we were shown to our table in record timing. Well, for a sushi restaurant. Very spacious, great modern decor, and plenty of seating. Well lit, with just the right amount of volume on the music.   Our server was great and gave us the full run through of the menu and drinks. No empty glasses here baby. Food came as fast as we ordered them. Well, at least from what I remember. Here's the rundown of what we ordered.  What ordered: Miso soup Ahi poke Calamari Baked mussel  Shrimp tempura Sizzling beef Beef asparagus   Nigiri: Tuna  Garlic Tuna Salmon Albacore Garlic albacore Yellowtail Ikura Uzura - quail egg Masago - smelt egg Tamago - sweet egg  Know what? We cleaned our plates. Yes we did. The fish is fresh. A bit light on flavor for the mussels, but amazing taste for the sizzling beef. Since I'm accessing long term memory and my   hippocampus isn't cooperating, I'll have to keep it short. (Note to self, write review within a week of visiting business).  This place is well worth the drive. Perfect for that elegant date, without the outrageous prices and AYCE bustle. We shall see you again FANCY!

6D0KbHcjfgQbf_03Kjw1Hg.text: Came here after the gym, so the restaurant was actually not too busy when we arrived around 1:30pm. The hostess seated our party of three quickly and our waitress took great care of us.  Did the AYCE option (and upgraded to the dinner option) since it was cheat day for one of our friends so we could ordered items only available for the dinner AYCE price. So we ordered all the dinner only items and the assorted nigiri that we often ordered. Every thing was great. Service from the sushi bar was quick and before long we were almost too stuffed to ordered desserts.  The one thing I have to constantly remember to do when dining at most Korean-operated sushi restaurants is to ask the chef to go easy on the sauce or serve it on the side for all of the specialty rolls. But that is completely a personal preference thing.  Baked Mussels were a good appetizer to start our meal.  Seared Salmon Nigri - yum  Salmon Skin + Fresh Salmon and Ikura Handroll - make sure they put all the ingredients in one hand roll and not make three different ones.  Unagi Nigiri - good, but even better if slightly more caramelized.   A la carte options, Lunch Specials are also available for anyone not in the mood for AYCE.

cE_Lqno3g0mh7RNqIKZZFg.text: AYCE with my lover. It was good as usual. We love the Japanese Lasagna, oh my yummy. So creamy and dreamy... love the oh my heart too! We ate, we loved and then loved some more.

Juh8MWbKsmFom1lKic9bHg.text: This was my first time checking out this location and I really enjoyed my experience! My wife and I came during the dinner rush and sat at the bar. We were warmly welcomed by the sushi chefs. I told the chefs that my wife was on the edge about eating raw fish but our sushi  chef Anthony accepted the challenge and blew our minds with his omakase choices. Our server Andy was also very attentive and quickly refilled our drinks and cleared our plates. We left very satisfied and will definitely be coming back with our closest friends.

Ja9Cp9jQfF6lRfuOdfZdaw.text: I've been to Oyshi many times and have never had a bad experience. I would recommend the pink lady and coco for sushi rolls. The atmosphere is contemporary and open.   The price for all you can eat is reasonable. Out of all the AYCE sushi restaurants I travel to Oyshi even with closer alternatives.

Y_jkO5kS6Db9TgiAD5GN-w.text: Rice is dry af.   The fish itself taste good but the rice is terrible. It's dry and grainy. I had to keep drinking water as I ate because their sushi would make my mouth dry and the rice would stick. The fish and rice ratio was way off. The fish is cut thin with a thick compressed dry rice underneath. All I eat is nigiri so it's sad that I didn't reorder nigiri for my second round.   The options here are a little limited compared to other AYCE sushi spots.   The inside is very clean and spacey which I really liked. The service was great. They were fast and always came by to ask if we wanted to order more.   Maybe I came on a off day but I didn't like this second visit here!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0vfY_Y24ZGDgkSRpyarQzg.text: Fantastic. Used to go to Kobe Sushi for all you can eat as well but they closed. Didn't think I'd find a replacement and it's even better.  It's not a buffet... simply order from alloys of options and enjoy.

orSTrzK2Z8u8-IWU7ys_8Q.text: Tonight we had a birthday dinner with co workers at Oyshi sushi and my review goes like this. 1-10 score  Service 7 Food 8  Atmosphere 8   Now why did I place a 7 and not a 10 possibly because it took approx 20 minutes until I received my water.  Food was good and fresh, a little thick on rice but expected because it's Ayce

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea creme brûlée. Yum!

QpD1oVfXs2TeastraEJFxQ.text: This is the first sushi restaurant I've been to that the rolls are so unique and flavorful with the care and ingredients that the chefs add to each roll that, quite frankly, adding soy sauce to their masterpieces does the rolls a disservice. If you see a sauce on a roll, don't even THINK about soy sauce! Enjoy the amazing ingredients as they dance across your pallet!

dOt-YtVfIR-6KQozIvyJfA.text: My wife loves to take me to eat sushi but she hates sea food, so it's really hard to find a place that serves all you can eat sushi and a good non sushi menu.    The menu was so large, I would definitely  have to come back to try their other signature rolls. Our server Sharon  Shen was very nice she made sure to check our tables for more orders or refills and even though she was busy with other tables she still had time to make small talk.   My wife got grilled beef asparagus she wasn't sure if this place had anything she might like so she ate before we came.  That's what we usually do and then she just gets appetizers but to our surprise Oyshi  Sushi  had a decent variety of things for her to choose from.  (Good to know for Next time)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu was a book , not a laminated  paper like other places so much to choose from &amp; so much to try
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spider roll , loved the soft shell  crab
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York  cheese  cake , first time I tried one without  gram crust

cJdgibX0Do-bIFbf6cErsw.text: Chef AG ALWAYS takes care of me when i come in. He is a fantastic chef!  Absolutely nothing to complain about.

CzyhlLGchflLrLue84HxBg.text: Mikey our server for tonight has been really pleasant and on top our orders good food + good customer service = A 5 Star review.

EXD4AtVUHW9iPcNLA4c2LA.text: Iv'e been here several times and have brought plenty of friends and family here. Sometimes it gets a little busy but that's why you can make a reservation! Favorite sushi place by far. I live in North LV and will make the drive. The lobster affair roll is my ultimate favorite along with everyone else's. Can't wait to go back!

1dAffKHtjbL6v_R21nnR2Q.text: Been going to Oyshi on Sahara & Tenaya for years now and over the years the service has been up and down, most times the servers are pleasant but the hostesses are RUDE, tonight was no different. I'm not one to knit pick so I can handle a few frowny faces and rolling eyes, not that I'm a difficult customer, quite the opposite, but I've had enough of their crap. I spend hundreds of dollars a year there so I don't think it's too much to ask to be treated nicely and met with a smile. The white 20-something snowflake looking girl who sat us needs to go! She doesn't smile, she throws the menus on the divider by the table and she has terrible customer service all around. First point of contact sets the mood and this irrelevant girl shouldn't be the face of any public establishment.  If you're craving really good sushi go to Naka Sushi on Lake Mead and Rampart in the shopping center next to Chase bank, they're alot smaller, kind of a hole in the wall but the people, workers and food are top notch. Oyshi is good but they're overrated and I'm tired of paying them good money to treat me like shit as if they're doing me a favor, if I could rate them -5 stars I would, giving them 1 is being generous. NAKA SUSHI is where it's at.

xPfsvpdgunsin-covJMlxg.text: My family and I are big fans of Oyshi. We come here every time we are at Las Vegas. All you can eat offers lots of options for you to enjoy. I highly recommend here for your lunch or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WA9lPL667F-xreN_GRperw.text: The food started yummy and plentiful the server Ryan was good.  We ordered the rib eye steak the first was plentiful then the second was less and the third round was more like where's the beef.  The Nigiri sushi was yummy.  See my photos.  The shrimp tempuras was hot I liked the red dragon.   Our food didn't come timely everyone was done with their dessert while I still waited for the Crete brulee.  Our server came to give us the check and I had to tell him we did not get the Crete brulee.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BO0C1OAGQ-dwzLueMSIhoA.text: Terrible. From the moment we walked in no one greeted us or even acknowledged us for a good 5 minutes. As we were about to walk us someone finally came to the desk and sat us. FYI no half sushi orders at tables, so we moved 2 feet over to the bar and it was ok... kinda strange. But what I couldn't deal with was dirty menus & dirty table tops. The sushi was just so-so. Definitely not worth $28 per person for all you can eat. Skimpy servings on the nigiri too. Definitely won't be back here. Oh and all the rolls have cream cheese wtf... I hate that!

5HckkHpXuGTZEbnVWhQing.text: This location is bigger and nicer than the one on Rainbow, I believe it is newer too. Came here with a friend for AYCE lunch. Lunch price is $23 or $24 and dinner is $27 if I remembered correctly Dinner price comes with oysters, uni, and sweet shrimp. We came in right when they opened, we were the first table for the day. Not sure what was going on but the hostess was not having it, she was not friendly and seemed annoyed having to seat us. She also helped ran food to our table and same attitude, grumpy and not happy, made us feel uncomfortable.   Our server was very nice, made recommendations and our drinks were constantly re-filled throughout our meal.   They have nice variety of rolls, lot of appetizers and other dishes you can order as part of your AYCE which is great. Rolls were pretty good, some better than others but overall I had a satisfied meal.   I have been to other places where the dinner price was lower and it comes with oysters, uni and sweet shrimp. $27 is pretty expensive for AYCE, especially since there are so many other AYCE places that offer similar options.   Overall, it was nice to try the place since my friend comes here all the time and she wanted me to try it out, but it wasn't as great of an experience for me. The hostess was the first turn off, and although the food was good I can go elsewhere for similar items but a little cheaper.

8qjkR4f7cNT2dVWVZo-oQw.text: This place was great. Buy one get one bottles of sake, excellent sushi combinations, great atmosphere, and not a huge loud music venue like most other places are nowadays.

zIMaTqCQSTcqiBWuyt72XA.text: Walked in at 10:20 pm since online it says they close at 11 and was turned away saying that they've already done last call. Poor service. Especially since we get off work late and was hoping for some sushi. Smh.

Xqfs6Kv2S2yrrT16lHdQPA.text: I can't go to another sushi restaurant  in Las Vegas.  Oyshi is the best one there and the $26 all you can tops it off.  This is not a buffet restaurant,  you order when you want more which makes the food fresh and hot.  My favs are the lobster lover, pork belly, salmon hand roll.   Oyshi is definitely a must try if you're ever in the area.

wGfTQ1yuqV6LGKoGK0UWdw.text: I love sushi and I love this place. It's nice little noisy but it has some beauty in it . good place . yummyyyy

22dhx8JJmmn-wZRQdBerrQ.text: When I walked into Oyshi and locked eyes with Golden...I knew I was about to get endless amounts of salmon belly in my mouth...and guess what...I did. Golden lifted me up on a whole new sushi level.

T2CIGmGkuWk5dvYwbtCr9w.text: So food was decent but our server ( fat dude with a beard ) was the slowest server i ever had. I wanted to order so i called him and he said just one second, after 20 minutes i had to call him again. He even walks slow. I understand that it was busy but him not coming and walking slow makes me never want to come back here. I wish i had a different server. If anybody is reading this and coming here, make sure to avoid the table he is serving. I hope the management take action.

bcAwn1TRrX7AkOEvGE6DMw.text: Had a great time here.  We ordered the crazy cali roll and the volcano roll.  Excellent service,  friendly staff and good food!  We will back.

XfMXgg6rtETxv0WLmNkTGw.text: We went with a group of 10 including 2 small kids for an early dinner at 530 on a Thursday. It was already packed. The service was very friendly but we waited over 25 minutes for our first round of AYCE. The food quality was ok but nothing to get too excited about. Prices were average. My biggest gripes were the layout- crowded floor and you have to walk through a wait station in front of the kitchen and not run into any servers to get to the restrooms...and the music. It was nightclub music- ok whatever- but it was as loud as a nightclub. The group consensus is that we probably won't go back. It wasn't a comfortable atmosphere and not worth that for the sushi.

CouxoB8J7xT-FZI_Hh_7aQ.text: Amazing lunch today!  Kenny was hands down the best server we have had here!  Very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu.  We loved the Nuclear Bomb roll and shashimi salad!

7Tc3wMUk9qgmbmqL0oY18w.text: BEST SUSHI BAR EVER. It was our first time there and I don't think I could ever go anywhere else again. Amazing sushi and the absolute best customer service I have ever had. Servers were very knowledgeable about promotions going on and made us feel so welcome. We did the Black Friday AYCE special and had 7 rolls (one of which the chef did half and half) and 2 orders of miso soup. Btw, be sure to get the J & B roll!!!!! We will absolutely be back soon. Great food, service, and atmosphere.

UUaor5VIKBNvXvMIh5uq-Q.text: My husband and I have been to a few sushi bars in Vegas and this is by far the best one we have been to so far.  If you can, get the bar seats.  They are best in the house and the chefs are all really great

yV72HzUZTXSwhOvmJPIqTw.text: Decent all ypu can eat sushi place. Close to my house so you cant beat that I can almost walk it.

s2oltCUAreX3e6wjkeBifQ.text: Kenny at Oyshi is awesome! We love coming here for the all you can eat sushi! It's one of our favorite sushi spots! Yum!

LC2tca4LKZgnuo6W-jyUAQ.text: Saw this Sushi place and something about it caught my attention, so I decided to check it out. My boyfriend and I went there on a Friday date night. The place wasn't busy at all, but there was a larger party in the back. The sushi was amazing!! I already want to go back. I can't even recommend one dish. They were all so so good.

Q537soPFvs9PGPCemQW_sA.text: Orders are efficiently on time, the food is great,  and the service is fast. Shout out to Kim!

SWamPqnRXlOH9XvtALJBpw.text: minus one....the worst service i ever had!!!never going back.i love oyshi on the south rainbow ,this location sucks...i've waited for the food for over an hour...

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FYPsvRIX2CdVlCIwLXb1bg.text: To all my fellow sushi lovers. Listen to the reviews that say the sushi is mediocre. Nice restaraunt nice staff but for the sushi I won't be back to this place. Hope you guys listen and don't do what I did and find out on your own.

zpxMkPFmNdpm42Zi85pt4w.text: LOVE this place, always great sushi and always fresh! Highly recommended for anyone who loves Fresh sushi.

qD4h84z_X6pHWmCG9rVPUQ.text: I've had a lot better sushi than here at Oyshi. The rolls were a little sloppy and so was the information on the food we ordered. It didn't quite meet our expectations, but left me full. Service here is pretty sad. Best part of this place is the ambiance, but the music is killing it. Excited to get the check and leave. No plans on coming back to this location...

HaCyf8DG64-2Rz4LAQ_uZw.text: The AYCE sushi here is unbelievable!! It's the best I've had in the city and I'm an avid sushi goer! The fish are fresh and miso soup is unbelievable!

Jm86dSyNOjYuHi13DsbwCQ.text: Not a bad place,  food is great. And staff is helpful and professional.  I will be returning to this place in the near future.  All you can eat, is the bomb,  and for not a bad price.  My first time here but it won't be my last.

KxJBwk7xzwKeU25GIh1G9w.text: This place is great! Although I'm not allowed to eat a lot of the food there, the menu has some great sushi. They have great All-you-can-eat prices!! They also have a kid's menu and other food that is not sushi.   The place is very nice! It's clean and spacious! They have a bar as well.

v2PXiBFMnLUmrNN-l3oLWQ.text: The food at Oyishi was amazing.  The fish was really fresh and you can tell that the sushi chefs knew what they were doing.   Everything was presented beautifully and also the taste was on point.  The food came out so quickly!   Our server was exceptionally good at her job.  We had a party of 17 and most of us all ordered all you can eat sushi but she never forgot any of our orders.   10/10, I'd go again.    Oh, and the green tea creme brulee is AMAZING!

2K83sVr07UpH053KdBLDdw.text: Very nice establishment kind of feels like you walking into a club to eat sushi about 30 bucks for the first 6 or so pages of the encyclopedia esque menu. They shout a loud Japanese greeting when you enter so be prepared to feel like Buddha himself with that welcoming there monster roll as well as the scallop crunch was delightful. Over all with a decent knowledge of where there fish come from and a menu that explodes off the menu  I might have found a new sushi stop here in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aOKCLWhpq0SQwcocfUtRMg.text: Second time there and both times food was great, love the environment but service is lacking big time. I thought the first time maybe just short handed on help. Nope, same bad service again. If the waiter would slow down a little and pay attention to customers, I'm positive he would get better tips.

XNW_qmyoR_RSc2C78mYteg.text: I'd give this place 6 stars if I could.   This is always our go to spot for sushi. The menu has a large selection of sushi that is made to order. So many rolls you have to go multiple times to try them all.  There is also 2 pages of just appetizers that come with the all you can eat.  Theres also an a la carte menu for the not so hungry.  Fish is always fresh!!!!   If you sit at the sushi bar you can order "half rolls" which is great for lunch. The chefs are awesome too.  Service is always impeccable. We love Kenny. Hes always attentive and making sure we are happy.   Favorite rolls are the Spicy Tuna Crunch and the Yellowstone.

whQvweLZlPPARAMTPfy4cA.text: This place has always been great when it comes to AYCE. I usually force feed my gullet to get to the green tea creme brulee. This is by far the best dessert I've had in my entire life. As far as the sushi goes I'm a big fan of the iris roll and garlic tuna. The surf and turf sizzle plate is worth it for sure and iced green tea is to die for. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable which is awesome too.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf roll
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dragon roll

7Z0yjeK59ST6g-VGLkUAXA.text: Stopped in with the Wife and Daughter today for one the trully best bites in Vegas in my opinion, My Man Kenny killed it as usual with his on point service and attention to detail!!!!  Much thanks to all the skillful hands behind the line.  If you don't know ....now you know! ------oyshi-----

uWaA3ADRfRmDNKT-Q_WuSA.text: Great fresh food! The wasabi was even super fresh ! The bento lunch special was a big portion and very tasty. I ordered the 3 hand tool special. A special note the yum yum scallops are actually a mix of mostly crab meat and a few scallops. So specify if you are looking for just scallops. Everything was delicious and the service was good too!

KGoFRtVdWjOZ2chIXYtwsQ.text: Warm welcoming love the set up. Would definitely come here again. If you do get a server named Kenny you are definitely in good hands.

UBJazaJDwsbj36d9J7n4Hg.text: Awesome service with Kevin at the bar. Great all you can eat whole menu! Bar. Sushi. Sushi bar. Won't go anywhere else. Family friendly. Food is perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat!
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serious Green Tiramisu  desert!

omBXMkPgWEDQNRRdC6keJg.text: We have been to this location several times and it has been several different Sushi places. I really enjoyed the Nuclear Bomb roll the most. All of the rolls we tried were decent. Really good place to do all you can eat. We did have trouble three times of them trying to bring us the wrong roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WbzGh2HBfEtY2vNA7jJ4oA.text: Such slow service! There were 6 empty tables and we waited 20 minutes just to get seated. On top of that we had to wait another 15 minutes for someone to come get our order. And when our server finally got to us, she stopped us abruptly and we didn't even finish ordering. Horrible service.

f9JJ105QD1fXAnL6fe3yaw.text: Just dined here for lunch. Very pleasant. Sushi was fresh, rice was cooked and prepared well, and the service was excellent. They were quick, friendly, and courteous. The servers and wait staff make you feel welcome and they don't act like they are doing you a favor when taking your order and delivering the good. Our favs were spicy tuna, ika with shiso, and unagi. The ambiance in this restaurant is comfortable- high ceilings, subtly decorated, and very spacious. This place beats Goyemon hands down. The only downside is that you are limited to one dessert per customer. If I have a craving for AYCE sushi, this will be my go to place.

0kVX8Zfvosu2Nb8t7p02Lw.text: Incredible Sushi rolls by Chef Pedro Lozada! Best sushi I've ever had and I didn't have any raw rolls since I'm pregnant! Totally recommend this place and this chef!

BO9kill4HHGKu_9hQ_XMww.text: Good service whenever my family of six go we always get seated quickly and served right away. Most of the servers are nice there was this one time when one of them was rude but besides that its always calm ,friendly ,and yummy place.

-PQzy31Eri41i7-upgahiA.text: Been craving sushi for some time now and the AYCE here really hit the spot. The sushi was well prepared and delicious. The atmosphere is fun and inviting.

m7bmbV8Ixj_MAg52xEibGQ.text: We came from out of town, really wanted sushi I know there is alot of great places on yhe strip, but didnt want to deal with the traffic at vegas blvd. We asked concierge at our resort where to get the best Sushi. They recommend this place. Amazing is all I have to say. Kenny the waiter was so good attentive, and the food was on point fresh delious. Honestly great spot to eat. Definitely will be coming back. Ask for kenny he is great!!

k6V6s4XOBAbMgR0sikh7Gw.text: Not only was the food fantastic but the waiter was amazing!!! And the owner actually bussed our table and spoke to us about our experience! Hands down the best!!!

341f4UIWAYtzMOXlKo7SgQ.text: Cool set up. Solid basic sushi rolls. I didn't try too many of the more complex options. Amigo roll was good. Tasty hamachi nigiri. Great berry vanilla dessert. Had AYCE. Will try again. Prefer Kaizen etc

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custom roll made by Daniel
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6whHDrVyuIr7vLlVCjLL7w.text: As of now, we have been waiting for 2 rolls as of 15 minutes ago. I decided to write the review and time myself until it gets to my table. The food tastes great, great quality, inside looks hip. But alas, my food is taking a WHILE. I waited 5 mins to post... 20 mins total for a rattle snake and a chicken teryaki roll.

yXWC1ny7Yw9t89gMnjje9w.text: What to say about Oyshi? It is hands down my favorite sushi/all you can eat spot in town. The Sahara and Buffalo location is by far the best! We come here often and are loyal! Great choices from appetizers to rolls to desert!

AnWNz9wY32Ef_aW6tII7kQ.text: Best AYCE in Vegas for low carb.  Rib eye appetizer and Sibuya not fried.  Keep them coming!!!!  Great service too and the best sushi chef Pedro!!!!

niyU3I08d_BElfbLdmC_qg.text: One of my fave places to come and eat sushi! Lunch special is 22 for all you can eat and dinner is 27 for all you cn eat. The ambiance is super cute and great for a date night!!

5iMLnXLgMsxtAD9j2B6ddA.text: Food is delicious, workers professional, clean place, environment is amazing. Shout out to Kenny our server AAAA++++ keep doing what your are doing!

tVhkPBPQXpC_ZulxzRgX2g.text: Been here multiple times and I have never had a bad time. The prices are typical so all you can eat is worth the price. Staff is friendly. The atmosphere is very laid back and pleasant.

FVoAo3ZEccfi7J9dvv01fA.text: Always great service and great food. There's a wide variety of food to choose from. The love affair is one of my all time favorite rolls. The atmosphere is always friendly and clean. One of my favorite places to have sushi in Vegas! Highly recommend!

60lADRf1TMLPvRsm5UImWg.text: First timer here and I'm SOLD!! Sushi and apps are on point! Our server was awesome! Very attentive and able to suggest roles & meat to our liking I will definitely be Coming back to this location no just for the great food but also for the fantastic service

Im4UmyACY4FHNhArxgN1vw.text: I like this location better than than rainbow location. Customer service is excellent, and the waiters are so nice! The wait is never long and the food is amazing! I drive from across town to eat at this location!

DNCCjvKf_5zqClThXRaW6Q.text: Oyshi is absolutely one of my favorite places for sushi in Vegas!  The food and service are consistently great. The sushi is always fresh and flavorful. The drinks and desserts are fantastic as well! I've never been disappointed with my experience at Oyshi.

a50quuB2r244rnPl9EyyTw.text: This place is awesome! Staff is always great, sushi is always on point. We live far from this location, but always go out of our way to make it out here because we love it so much. Highly recommended!

tOHLrkblh6_YRHOlibACUQ.text: We love this place! I do not eat raw sushi but they have a selection to satisfy everyone on their menu.

1vStuooKkTH9r0JaDDRvbQ.text: Love, love, love this place! I was first brought to Oyshi by a friend and since then, I've been back  6 times with the same friend, other friends, and my boyfriend. It is now his favorite sushi bar in Las Vegas! Service is good, fish is always fresh, desserts are tasty, and the facility is gorgeous! They also consistently play my favorite songs.

IVsWZTN5Zxbo2ThFMAmKwg.text: Awesome sushi place! Loli has some great interpersonal skills and she made our dinner a plus! Will be coming back every time sushi is on our mind. Thank you staff of oyshi!

TIKKtrqBN_WQzFwf4LXK5Q.text: If I could give zero stars I would. Came here for dinner. When I checked in the lady told me it would be 20-30 minutes. After an hour and a half passed we finally are seated. It took 15 minutes to get a waitress over. We put our drinks and food in... 45 minutes later.. still had not received our food. We brought the matter up to the manager and he said if we didn't like it we knew where the door is. I am very disappointed. I will be calling the higher ups of the restaurant and will never be back. Thanks for nothing

rBPl0Lo5mzY8p2PQIcERsg.text: Pretty good place. We had the AYCE for lunch. You can't get some items for lunch,  only for dinner i.e. Uni. The service was very good. Our server was Jay and he was on point with placing our orders and topping of our drinks. He missed some of our orders but nothing drastic.  I suggest you eat here with 4 or more so you can split the rolls. They only do half rolls at the sushi bar.  The place is very spacious and they have private rooms.  I like this place and I will probably be back.

_4pPZgCm3Xhy3hJdWX2dMQ.text: Literally haven't had a bite to eat yet, but Kenny G. is pretty sweet and AYCE is $27. Winning!

iRlIWBDYgYfhg9tqMEkQYA.text: My boyfriend and I go to the Rainbow location pretty often but we saw there was another location and wanted to try it out. When we got there we were seated pretty quickly, but it took a while for the waitress to acknowledge us and take our order after that point. The food was delicious as always, but the service could have been better. We will stick to the Rainbow location in the future.

N-Bd4alT1ppix-BNDzZYsw.text: The all you can eat is very well priced. I got a hand roll and one specialty roll and my bill was 21 bucks so for 6 more dollars I could have stuffed myself. Spicy tuna and avocado can be hit or miss two days ago it was perfect and beautiful. Today the spicy tuna was ridiculously hot and the avocado was brown. The specialty rolls are definitely not the combinations that I typically prefer. (But they do allow custom orders with AYCE). Kinda like they are trying to hard to be different. The baked mussels are the business. The mojito was awful. This was close to home we will be back to try more stuff.

N1_igNSa7sd36ALwdbKW0g.text: Amazing sushi I come here once a week and get all you can eat. You can pretty much get anything you want for lunch it's only $21 and it's really good food. I like coming for lunch because it's slower, this place gets pretty busy on the weekends. We like sitting at the sushi bar because you can order faster and the guys are super cool. Plus you can get half rolls. I love the house salad and they have an awesome sake martini :)

6FvivHdyeE5H5Gn5Wchoig.text: By far our best AYCE Sushi spot I've had. Service and atmosphere is on point!! Huge menu and the food is delicious. You won't be disappointed!!

HL3pWalnrW1TCuP2GDojug.text: I've been going to this hidden gem for about 7 years now whenever I'm in Vegas. The AYCE option cannot be beat. The sushi is fresh and always prepared right. Their lobster fair roll is out of this world. Every time I'm in town I have to stop here. Great service and great sushi!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Fair Roll
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly Roll
Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Storefront

tbV9yzHDAeqJl0SWQMHzKA.text: Where do I start! When we arrived they had a large table set for 23. We ordered, half my order never came. So I brought it to our waiters attention. He NEVER COMES BACK! The manager took the rest of our orders. Then the waiter casually strolled by..  and asked anything else! WOW! Well we will not be returning. Idk if he's just a horrible waiter or angry he forgot to put in the order. Be careful how you remind your waiter about forgetting something. He may never return.

0E832vvKn1azB2plXPMQew.text: I was visiting town and decided to eat here for the all you can eat sushi. It was disgusting! The sushi cuts were horrible and the fish tasted old. It seemed that the sushi was made by an amateur, and on top of it I found a bone in my sushi. Very unprofessional for a sushi place. It was fine that they make you eat all of the rice of the sushi, but at least make the fish a quality size to go along with the rice. It was obvious that the place was bad from the first bite, I guess if it's too good to be True then it's probably not good.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish bone in sushi

xZ71Rcehf3NyN9qnhoUkpQ.text: Not good place to eat they look like they dont care about clients at this place we was waiting  there for a long time they keep taking big group of people maybe cuz is more money so we left and definitely we are not coming back to this place.

sD9PzMxaDimXivdegmMqDA.text: A friend recommended this place as my boyfriend and I were looking for a good sushi buffet during our vacation in Las Vegas. We are happy to say it didn't disappoint! The service was very friendly and fast! We had the AYCE (all you can eat) order and was happy with the selection. My favorites were the Lobster Fair & vegetable tempura. The tentsuyu had good flavor and the tempura was nice and light. Hoping to get back there again one day!

fQiS0J1zbmTQrDiGwW26Ow.text: Paid $30 on doordash for this and they gave me 4 pieces of sushi and 4 odd shaped cone rolls. I asked for my rolls cut and to have cream cheese and they did neither of those things. Do not waste your money. $8 for 4 pieces of sushi? Not 4 rolls. 4 pieces.  Update: the sushi was so bad that even my dog wouldn't eat it. She literally eats cat poop

r2XWrC7oPT_jUmZymbmRxQ.text: Solid selection.  Decent price for lunch AYCE.    If you need sushi -stop here and enjoy.

U6pAj77TEYz2l7g4rulGgA.text: Really good ayce sushi. They get busy but staff works hard. Good quality and freshness. Nice assortment of rolls, appetizers, etc.

OO15JJJL90Dwj96keSFupw.text: Adding to my review...we've continued coming here for our sushi cravings and Anthony, Sushi Chef, is a creative master at making delicious off-menu rolls. Love the food, love the service, if you haven't tried this place yet - what are you waiting for?

bQPwqmPPWOXRqO_eS7k22A.text: The decor is nice, and the service was okay, however I did find myself wondering while I was sitting there "is this a sushi place or a rice place?" Everything we ordered was mostly rice. At that point I wouldn't be surprised if the water came with rice too. I get it, rice fills you up and it's a business but when you're serving up rice with fish garnishes that's how you loose business- I don't plan on coming back. I'm pretty sure there was more meat in onigiri than their rolls. Not to mention how long it took for everything. I believe that this place would be decent if those 2 things were fixed.

j-0ZMHUSfdOSliDIglmzJA.text: My mom's friend picked this place and she's very particular about what she eats with her limited diet so I went in trusting.  They have some cool rooms off to the side where larger parties can have more privacy (not total).  It's a trendy-looking place with modern vibes and polite, helpful staff.  It's off the beaten path for tourists, so you're more likely to run into locals here.  Lots of parking in that strip mall so we found front row spots in the early evening during the week.     For dinner they offer 2 menus, one for entrees and one for sashimi / sushi.  I asked about the AYCE option but it's not self service.  You'd have to keep ordering and if you're self conscious about people whispering about your eating capacity, probably not the safest choice. Some of our party ordered the sukiyaki (Mom said it was on the sweet side, but she liked it), salmon teriyaki, rib eye teriyaki and I don't recall the rest.  I had some salmon sashimi with a rainbow roll.  My aunt shared a lot of her ribeye and it was great, but it comes out sizzing on a hot plate so if you don't eat it right away it quickly turns from being medium rare to well done.  :-/  Didn't like that form over function choice but is okay since I avoid red meat.  My meal was okay.  Nothing mouth popping.  It's a little pricey.  My meal was well over $20 and other dishes range around $15 to $18 for a single serving.  It's not a bad choice for sushi but not worth going out of your way to visit.

DxRgxwRaL33n3cWyj6gniA.text: My first experience with sushi in Las Vegas was at the original Oyshi on Rainbow.  I decided to give this place a try tonight as it's much closer to home.  I ordered AYCE and with iced tea and tax, the cost was just under $32.  Items ordered:  Sweet shrimp Uni Agedashi tofu Miso Spanish mackerel (nigiri) Salmon belly (nigiri) Yellow tail (nigiri) Dynamite (baked in a round pan not a roll) Sibuya (deep fried 5 piece roll with no rice) Lava flow (8 piece traditional roll) Green tea tiramisu  One of the rules is you can only get one order of uni and sweet shrimp per person.  I ordered those first from the appetizer section.  I'd pass on these two items again.  The uni wasn't that great and there was nothing special about the sweet shrimp.  The miso was fairly traditional.  The three nigiri that I ordered for the second wave were just OK.      Then the best part came.  The dynamite in a pan is very good.  It's a baked crab mix with scallops, onions, mushrooms, and shrimp with a yum-yum sauce.  It's baked and topped with the sauce and sesame.  Very enjoyable.  The Sibuya is a 5 piece--no rice--deep fried roll filled with spicy tuna, salmon, cooked shrimp, and avocado topped with smelt eggs.  The topping is yum-yum and eel sauces.  This had a good spiciness to it with the spicy tuna and the deep frying gave it a good flavor.  Finally, if you like a little heat, the Lava Flow is spicy tuna and asparagus inside and topped with seared whitefish and jalapenos with added topping of Nyi sauce and flaming chili sauce.  Tasty.  For dessert, I got the green tea tiramisu--a green tea cake soaked with green tea.  A good ending.  My server was Ray and he was excellent giving me some suggestions.  Service from the sushi bar was prompt.  I was brought a new iced tea just before I finished my first glass.  With some of the spicy food, you needed a cool down.  An OK dinner.

wMe1zUg--2xGMgzXdEzXIg.text: Sad to say, but this restaurant has gone down in service and quality over the past few years.  I dined in here with my family for my mom's birthday. My mom was craving her beloved "love affair" roll and green tea ice cream parfait so we decided to dine in here. Sadly, we found out towards the end of our meal that they didn't even have green tea ice cream. :(  Service: It could improve a lot. Our waiter made it seem like we were just another table to wait on. It seemed like he just hated his job overall, no smiles at all. We had to remind him a few times on some missing items.   We kept getting incorrect orders brought out to us and had to reject them probably twice. We either received 2x or 1/2 of our item orders. For example we only ordered 2 orders of amaebi, we received 3 orders. No big deal. Then maybe 5 min later they brought out 3 more orders of amaebi that we rejected. We ordered 5 orders of baked mussles and we only received 3 orders of baked mussles.  I'm not sure if it was a server/kitchen mistake, but we tolerated it.  We were missing two of our rolls and mentioned it to our waiter. He even admitted that our rolls might have been dropped off to the wrong table. At this point you'd think he would try prioritizing our rolls, but no he didn't. We told him we still wanted them (since we were still hungry from waiting for all of our orders still). He warned us that it might take awhile for our food to come out because the kitchen is backed up. That's not our problem that our food got dropped off to the wrong table.   We noticed none of the employees had any sense of urgency. Two tables next to us weren't bussed for an hour.   Quality of the food: Every time my family eats AYCE Sushi, we normally use a lot of wasabi and ginger. This wasn't the case. We received a watered-down wasabi and old ginger. Their nigiri isn't the freshest. My brother loves Uni and when he tried a nibble of it, he spat it out instantly. lmao. He said that the uni texture was jelly-like and tasted very fishy. Their "love affair" roll that we came for states that they use lobster. I honestly believe the "lobster" is just a bunch of crawfish tails. However, I think their meat is good though.  We had their grilled beef asparagus and surf and turf roll, and I think those were the highlights for me.   Cleanliness: When we first arrived, we were handed our plates for our wasabi and ginger. We were given two plates that were dirty that we didn't use. So I recommend checking guys' plates! The ladies' restroom needs to be cleaned and stocked. They were out of toilet paper and there were used paper rolls/napkins everywhere. Their bathroom checklist was public and I noticed they don't keep track of their bathroom checks. I'm going to assume they check it daily and forget to sign off of it, but considering their check list is open to the public eye.. it isn't a good sight to see for other dining patrons.  I'm giving them 2 stars because our past experiences from 3 years ago were all good and we didn't have any prior issues.

HqHDtdANXMri4Wg_3jpNUQ.text: Yummy! A new favorite Ayce sushi spot for me. The fish was fresh, and very delicately prepared. It made the experience more personable and fun! He kept our drinks coming as requested, and constantly made sure our table was clear. We will definitely be back!

HeS4Ua8TmwQMaVpcnL3gYw.text: 4/8/2018:  This is our first visit here. Hubby took the AYCE lunch @ $23.00 and I had the Dinner Sushi @ $18.00.  For my meal, miso soup was served first and it was nothing to write home about. Bland and watered down. Certainly not full-bodied and there was no real "miso" taste to it. It's like they were holding out on the miso - too expensive to put more in the soup? To their credit, though, they did put a generous amount of wakame (seaweed) but only a small amount of tiny, tiny cubes of tofu. Dang. Tofu isn't THAT expensive! Eating their miso soup was like drinking lightly-flavored miso water mixed in with wakame and a diminutive amount of tofu bits.  Then came the tossed salad, which was a good-size salad but the dressing was minuscule. So stingy on the dressing, OMG.   The tempura dish was very good! Hot (temperature-wise) and flavorful and I thoroughly enjoyed THIS dish!  Now the main dish came out, which was a variety of sashimi on top of shredded daikon (radish) and shiso leaves (very delish...LOVE these leaves!). No rice. After a long while, I finally inquired about having rice and the gal looked on our table, noting no rice there and retrieved a bowl of round-top rice.   Now back in the day when I was growing up, you NEVER served rice with a rounded top. This way of serving rice was reserved for dead people. Yep...DEAD people. My grandma used to serve little bowls of round-top rice to her deceased husband on a little Buddhist shrine she had in her bedroom.  As for the overall ambience, it was beautiful but the music they played was incongruous to the Japanese theme! Instead of quiet-tone, Asian-type music which would have been conducive and appropriate to dining and digestion, they blasted their nightclub-type music which was almost too loud for conversation. Management apparently thinks people enjoy having their eardrums blasted while eating sushi! Taste in music was pure hell - to us, anyway. Even if they played the same type of music but toned down the volume, that would have been tolerable. But they force patrons to listen to music of THEIR liking. Bad business! They are thoughtless to customers' taste in music. If you're going to inflict YOUR type of music on your patrons, have the decency to turn the volume down to background music.  As for the food server, first we had a female take our order and then later on, a male came to our table. He acted like we were putting him out when we asked for more water and a to-go box, which he brought. But when I asked for a plastic bag for the to-go box, he almost sarcastically asked me if there was anything ELSE I'd like??? My goodness. What an attitude! He's there for a job and it's his job to service patrons. It's also HIS fault that he didn't bring a plastic bag along with the to-go box. That's only common sense: You need a plastic bag to put your to-go box in, just in case the box leaks - which DID happen on the ride home.  Not once during our meal did ANYone come to our table to refill our water or ask if everything was alright.  Overall, we did enjoy our meal but because of the ambience, poor service, poor attitude, poor choice of music, lack of service/concern for its patrons, and food quality and amount, we will not be back. There's just too many other places from which to choose! Well you never know until you try, and we tried! Been there, done that.

LCcxN2K3nW5W_UK-BgusNw.text: AYCE sushi is always better with a group!  Ordering a bunch of different things and sharing them all is the best way to go with AYCE sushi because you discover what you love and what you don't want to go back for. This is the second location in town and it's a very nice spot. The layout, decor and fun seating arrangements are the best part of this place. The food is ok, good but not fantastic.  Vegas has so many incredible sushi spots so having as many options as we do oyshi should offer half rolls and a few sashimi options. Most sushi places do and the ultimate giveaway is the rice to fish ratio. This place is big on rice. They also didn't carry super white. WTF?   So we came in a big group and ate our hearts out but I didn't have any unbelievable moments. Some things were better then the others and my favorites from this place were the iris roll, unagi and Spanish mackerel. But again nothing was a wow. Lots of rice and a 1 hour limit.   The company was great so overall we had fun but with so many sushi options this isn't at the top of my list.

f_1b6UAyJVJrPWNDRvpH4Q.text: Excellent service, great and friendly team of servers! Did the AYCE and what a bargain...7 different rolls, eel, and beers! p_56XXw-eSEQEv74d0ObBg.text: Came in solo as a traveler on a Wednesday early evening. Pretty limited clientele at the time, buy you can tell the ambience stays pretty relaxed and fun. Staff was nice, but not necessarily consistent  (few grumpy folks when I stayed at the sushi bar, but maybe more so cause I eventuality just put my headphones on).   Sushi and sashimi were both quality (sorry not a roll guy much). However, they weren't very traditional in preparation, as some sushi didn't come with the traditional automatic wasabi between rice and cut, or the brush. Not a big deal.   They offer an endless option for $32 or $37 For lunch or dinner respectfully.  I'm sure it would be worth it with the higher end, expensive rolls.   Overall, I'd definitely come again, and/or bring friends. Solid local option.

7PXLfpkeMJgicIuklDXBpw.text: Sushi can be so strange, and so personal, and opinions are like *ssholes - everyone's got one. But this must be said: I love Oyshi Sushi on Sahara.   IF you come here often, you learn the pace and the chefs will learn your taste and it's like chocolate and peanut butter: magic will happen.  If you come here thinking you've got the most sophisticated sushi palate on the planet, take your stuck-up self somewhere else. Because this AYCE is not about how much uni or conch or surf clam you can talk them into giving you. It's about sitting at the sushi bar and biting into creative hand rolls that are handed to you by hand - enjoying the crackle of the toasted nori cone and having a cool time with a team of what are probably the coolest sushi chef personalities in the city. It's about enjoying the game on the generously-sized HDTVs while experiencing awesome service. My water cup / green tea cup is NEVER empty here - that is a rare thing, especially at an AYCE sushi spot!  My favorite kitchen item is their deliciously tender and flavorful 'Asian Skirt Steak' served sizzling on a bed of onions and cabbage (included in AYCE), solid apps and skewers (also included) as well as appealing gyoza (steamed or fried) and other standard "Midwestern" Japanese kitchen items are all included.  Not a fan of the species of oysters they serve (and I love oysters) - weird texture - so I just don't order them anymore. There are plenty of other things I like ordering. Fresh scallop sushi (better than Sushi Koma's), the 'Monster' hand roll (soft shell crab, eel, spicy crab, avocado) and a few other secret items that I'm not going to disclose because I don't want them to be out of them the next time I go, which is currently once-a-week whenever possible.  This place is the jam. (Go and discover it for yourself.)

G9BsjTF7pFALwlvxIUCaiw.text: Love Love Love ! Great all you can eat sushi! Clean! Good atmosphere open parking . Sometimes when busy they can be a bit slow or forget and order but the staff are always friendly and get it to you. Great variety of sushi to pick from and yummy Mochi. I recommend , why not give it a try

33sBYDmyB3H53McHjLXcRg.text: I am a big fan of sushi and this is my favorite place in Las Vegas. Very spacious and pleasant to enjoy your lunch or dinner. I will definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I2QupyEizYKkb2564zYZng.text: I've been going to Oyshi Sushi's Rainbow location for many years (it was my favorite sushi staple), and was delighted when it's sister Sahara location opened since it was much closer to where I live.    Oyshi consistently delivers fresh tasty quality sushi to its customers.  The deep variety of choices on their menu provides both cooked and raw choices for a varied crowd of people to be able to come together and share a Japanese style menu even though some guests don't indulge in eating raw seafood.  Their traditional sushi is so skillfully prepared that their yellow tail at times seems to just melt in your mouth.  They have so many varieties of rolls that a first time visitor could spend quite a while choosing from their assortment.  After years of coming here I can recommend some of my favorites.  The Rainbow Roll is a traditional California roll topped with a variety of seafood (tuna, salmon, yellow tail) in a mouth watering colorful display.  For a spicy roll, I enjoy the Red Rock.  It's a roll filled with spicy chopped salmon, served with a spicy mayo type topping. It's not the I have to drink water type of heat, but it has just enough heat not to blow out you taste buds.  If you're a soft shell crab lover, I highly recommend the Spider Roll.  The Spider roll contains fried soft shell crab parts layered in a crab mixture, placed in a roll.  It's slightly warm, extremely tasty, and the crunch from the soft shelled crab provides a delicious mild crunch to a roll that you just cant get enough of.  The all you can eat selection also includes tempura selections as well as rib eye steak served sliced in smaller pieces, with onions on a sizzl'n hot metal based plate. If you are still able to handle dessert, they offer a sunday or moche with the all you can eat option.  Beer, Cocktails, assorted beverages and hot tea (at additional prices) are available.  Their all you can eat lunch price is slightly lower than their dinner price, so you can expect to pay approximately 25 per person for lunch and 30 per person for dinner. Of course you could purchase off the menu for lighter appetites.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halloween at our favorite Sushi Bar.

VqBfLyTvh7Ii3NuKkEODAw.text: This place is our go to sushi place! We have never had a bad experience here and will never stop coming here. My favorite roll is the Kamikaze roll and my fiance loves the spicy rolls. And the best part is that they have a lot of apps that my daughter cab enjoy and she sure does. Also another favorite roll is the crazy Philly which is good and crunchy. The customer service is great and I would recommend it to anyone that is looking for a great sushi place, because this one is definitely one of the best! Thanks for everything!

u387Tvpfy2ZqL0j0dEyyeg.text: Overall everything was fine, the food was good, sushi chef Daniel was good and knowledgeable, but tell the server to shut up already.    He kept telling us that we should go to SLS's K***** and eat at his other job because the sushi and fish was so good there.  Every time he stopped by he would bring it up.  Soooo annoyinggggg.    Anyways, I did the all you can eat so I had many different types of fish while my friend ordered pork belly by recommendation of Daniel.  Everything was good and we had a little extra to take home.    I like this location a lot better than their original but lay off the annoying upsell of a different sushi establishment!  Geez.

yK93vktRZ9ONn9ZiaBE-Hg.text: First time eating here. It was a Saturday around 5pm. We had AYCE sushi which was $27 per person. We ordered the sea urchin, tiger roll, rainbow roll, spider roll, shrimp tempura, hawaiian roll and some other appetizers. He sea urchin was very good - tasted very fresh. The tiger roll was also pretty good. The spider roll was a little weird - first it was cut super thin and fell apart when I would try and pick it up. Then it had bits of hard pieces. At first I thought it was rice that was dried out then I realized it was pieces of tempura batter from the shrimp which makes me think the shrimp tempura used in the roll was not fresh.  And then the rainbow roll seemed very dry for some odd reason.   The place was clean. Service was good and I liked the fact that it wasn't super small or super crowded like many sushi places In the area.

ODtAF-AdMeJy0ugjKPW1wg.text: Okay so I've been to this location multiple times, before I had pretty bad service...however the new assistant manager was serving us this time and he was awesome. I believe he said he just got promoted to that position recently and it seems like whatever they are changing is working. The staff was super friendly and the kitchen was super fast! I went with my husband and 2 kids and we ordered all you can eat for us and for the kids we got chicken. At the end we ordered ice cream for all of us and he was so nice for no reason at all took the kids ice cream off the bill. I have absolutely not one complaint about the way they are running this restaurant and hope they continue to do so! We just had our 3rd kid and when I'm recovered we're definitely going back!

9NLIfvfArtHPw2gXPrf9Fg.text: Excellent fresh sushi, an all you can eat menu, and great customer service!  I rotate between the rainbow location and this one depending on who is working.  Father's Day was a busy night. Still, the restaurant reserved my seating for three in front of Chef Daniel at the Sushi Bar.   The all-you-can-eat menu is pages long and includes sizzling hot plates (e.g., surf & turf), cold salads, hot soups, tempera, sushi combinations, and one selection from their dessert section for about $25.00. Although the Hamachi Kama isn't included in the all-you-can-eat price, I usually order it. It is on of my favorites.  The atmosphere is relatively quiet and roomy. The lighting is dime in the evening. This restaurant offers a more private atmosphere with room for large parties as well. They have a full service bar. They have TV's at the bar and the sushi bar.   The restaurant often has daily sushi fresh catches that are available for the all-you-can-eat patrons. I love when they have the red snapper and fresh conch.   You won't be disappointed!
