ZGomXJgUX8D1F1XKkJ9OmA.text: One of the best AYCE sushi places in Vegas. The food was great! I love the fact that you can get so many options at this restaurant for the all you can eat. The had a great selection of appetizers like rib eye steak, agedashi tofu, shrimp tempura, etc. all of which I thoroughly enjoyed.   The nigiri sushi was just the right size. I appreciated the smaller rice portions which allowed me to order a variety of things without getting too full too fast.   The service is a bit slow, that's the only reason I gave it a 4 and not a 5.

Gy58HJiIWBzhTfQvs4eJ1w.text: White Girl at cashier with pony tail has a bad attitude not good for business.. waiters are great! So my 1 1/2 year old grandson wanted  fries and they do not have fries so I went to McDonald's and got him some fries and the bitch girl at the cashier says sorry no outside food and I told her it's for a baby that can't eat sushi, so she went and got her manager and the manager made a big deal outta of the fries.. anyways I won't be going back their again!! Me and my family have been going there for over 2 years! It's sad they won't let a baby take a small fry in and they lose my families business , I probably spend around 2k a year there. Oyshi you suck!!

romADczW4nw030J2iEPKVw.text: Excellent selection, lobster fair is delicious.  Good and friendly service.  Highly recommended....  I shall return

r8SEwTf2T48RNHmDX3eM-w.text: AYCE sushi is equivalent to the happiest place on earth for me. I can't believe this was my first time here because they have so many appetizer, nigiri, and roll options. I'm seriously so impressed!   Sushi: great quality seafood. The fish to rice ratio is fair and not as generous as Sushi Neko, but the quality makes up for it. I tried the salmon, tuna, fresh scallop (A MUST), sweet shrimp, uni, oysters, and eel. Their appetizers are the best I've ever had at an AYCE sushi restaurant. I had ahi poke, shrimp tempura (crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside), and mussels. The mussels were the worse because it wasn't creamy or flavorful enough.   Desserts: AMAZING! They have more than your usual ice creams and mochi ice creams, like a variety of creme brulees, tiramisu, etc. The green tea creme brulee was more like a flavored whip cream in my opinion; I like mine more thick and creamy but still sweet and good nonetheless.   Service: Kenny was our server and he was fantastic. It was super busy when we came in, but he still found time to be attentive and catered to us. He made conversation, suggestions when we were hesitant and deciding on what to order, and my favorite items were from his recommendations. Thanks for not judging me when I ordered like 10 items as my first order lol.   Overall: Oyshi is on my top 5 AYCE sushi restaurants. I can't complain with great service and quality fish. I'll definitely be back!

Ey3ul67DPxKHdT7FWt4NRA.text: Oyshi sushi is a wonderful and spacious environment to spend time with friends. Their croquette with mustard and donkatsu sauce was diving. Our server mikey is fun and very attentive. My boyfriend ordered all the spicy rolls off of the all you can eat and he reports that they are spicy and good. Great features for all you can eat which include poke and they also have buy one get one free sake! Craving sushi? Come here  It's my second time here and the food is amazing as always. The seared garlic salmon seems smaller than before but maybe it is a smaller plate. The sushi is always fresh and the sake is delicious, ayce is an amazing deal. Our server Chloe is amazing and has friendly service as well as being very attentive. I will be coming back for the delicious sushi and wonderful service.

ja5mFvgzuXxsz5Oj5IKIiQ.text: Been to the one on Rainbow many time and typically have a good experience with the food and service so I decided to give the Sahara location a try. All I can say is not the same. The the fish that came out was semi warm and mushy like it's been sitting out a little while before being prepared and served. Not sure if it's the refrigeration or the preparation method but this location needs to step up their game. Hearing employee banter all night about how someone wants to hook up with another employees sister also didn't help this locations cause.

zkBMS4oWzWc3r4Sr2Qwv9A.text: The service was great! Sushi not so much.  My husband and I eat a lot of sushi and are very particular about the places we go to, so when we went to this one thinking it was going to be similar to the one on rainbow, boy were we wrong.  We always order nigiri and maybe a couple of specialty rolls and the ones we had gotten the rice tasted old and the fish was very stiff. We also ordered an eel roll and it was falling apart and overly dressed. Needless to say, we are definitely not coming back to this one and will just stick to our regular spots.

3KTKhuXCA6Y__OLvf0x6rQ.text: My husband and I decided to come over to Oyshi for a bite to eat while our car was being serviced across the street. We sat at the sushi bar and we were happily surprised to see a sushi chef we knew from another spot, years back....... so, he knew what we were looking for, we are not the typical AYCE customers...... I prefer quality to quantity!!!!! The Mu sake is one of our favorites. The perfect compliment to good sushi! So that set us off to the perfect start! I will say that if you are into the AYCE sushi.... this is probably a great spot for you, they have a huge selection of rolls, sushi, appetizers, and I was pretty impressed when I saw the final bill.  Me personally, I appreciated the selection of fresh fish and the chef guided us in the right direction every step of the way.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mu Sake

9AwxoNCVbvZU5POBmy7jgw.text: Horrible service and food. Came to dinner for the AYCE with a group of nine and the wait service couldn't be any worse. The food ordered either didn't come or was mixed in with another plate (with somebody who's not even seated next to you). There were long wait times before your first and your second order (that's if you actually got what you ordered). We kindly pointed it out to the manager that we weren't getting the appropriate service and all she did was rush through some of the missing orders (and yes I said some because there were still other orders never came). After a while (an hour) it became comedic that one of the first rolls we ordered finally showed up (after telling the waitress no less than 5 times that it was missing). It was the crunch shrimp tempura roll (which, judging by amount of time it took for them to prepare, is apparently a complicated roll).   Overall this was not a good experience. The waitress was disorganized and bad and the manager was ineffective. The idea of an all you can eat sushi sounded good but this place is no where near worth the money you pay to eat there ($28 per person). Oh and the worst was we had to pay 18% gratuity since we were a party of 9. Needless to say they did not earn it.   Bonus: we asked for wasabi (since you know, we are eating sushi) and they brought us two HUGE mounds of wasabis bigger than a fist size for us to share. I mean who needs that much wasabi?!?!? Lol

RCWjsZ1FFZTCo31nNYVStA.text: This sushi spot is actually bad. First the spelling of delicious in Japanese is spelled Oishii. In addition, to the wrong spelling the had our orders wrong. I stayed in this restaurant for 2 hours, but only ate for 30 minutes because of the long wait. As for the food it was bearable. When you order the same food, the servings become smaller. I would not recommend this restaurant, rather go to Sushi mon.

AnBMUuObTBZOqpZocD4PYw.text: This is mainly an all you can eat sushi restaurant. The restaurant had a very pleasant and modern appearance. This location is great for large parties as there is a ton of space for it. Just keep in mind that parties larger than 8 ppl would include a service fee.   All you can eat includes an appetizer, sushi, specialty rolls and dessert for $27 (dinner price). It does not include sashimi which is standard at most AYCE restaurants. We sat at the bar which was really the best place to be. We had the opportunity to talk to Chef Daniel who made some of his recommendations and made us some sushi rolls that were off the menu.  Honestly, his creations should be part of the menu as they were unique and excellent.   The appetizer menu was very extensive with plenty of options! Every single dish we tried was fresh and very tasty. The only roll I did not like was the spider roll. It appeared the eel was fried hours before and was not very fresh. Overall, I was very happy with the atmosphere, service and the quality of the food!

YJeQOYzlDkDp2Kgt444O7g.text: This place delivered the worst service I have ever gotten in Vegas. We ordered from Vince our waiter and right away he said the rolls will "take a while." We waited an hour and a half before finally checking on our order only to find out that they had forgotten to place our order altogether! Vince our waiter said "oh I thought that someone delivered it already" there was not a sorry or anything. Vince had no regard for our time and gave the impression that he couldn't care less. We asked to speak to the manager who said she would get our food delivered right away. Another 30 minutes passed before we even received our order. They then refused to comp any of the 4 AYCE meals. They did offer house sangria that "was just made this morning"   We arrived at 7:00pm were seated at 7:45pm and didn't leave until 10:16pm. Do not come here unless you have hours to spare. Such a bad experience for my family that I had brought here from out of town. Terrible!

UwmOYvd7jLG0nCYRmg3CjA.text: One of the worst experiences I've ever had. Food was good, but it took 15 minutes to be acknowledged, another 10 minutes to get our water. We finally placed our first round of AYCE sushi and it took almost an hour to not even get everything that we had ordered.  We finally had enough and decided to just figure out how much each individual order was and cover it with tax and left.  Here's the worst part, the server came out to get us as we got back to our car and told us we needed to pay the full price for the AYCE since we "got food" even though we barely got anything. Also that server who confronted us literally only talked to us once. Didn't bother to check in, and starting cussing us out saying he would have to pay for it out of his pocket. And then he turned around and said it wasn't even his table. Eventually we went back in and told the manager we weren't paying anything extra than the individual orders and she said ok.  Absolutely inexcusable. The kicker was that we went to McDonald's right after and they apologized for the wait when it would take 2 extra minutes for the fries to be ready.

RRAkVrzsN63PRgPwxGrvfg.text: The best sushi in the world!! The menu is huge... and the best thing is the "all you can eat". Everytime i stay in vegas i go to oyshi!  I recommend!!

9JOh1eo6zKpV57TiidetMg.text: Lunch $ 21.00 / Person - Dinner $ 26.00 / Person for AYCE.  Rice, rice, rice and a brick of rice in my belly. This place really knows how to give the illusion of a good fish to rice ratio by giving lengthy fish slices, but underneath you meet your doom of impending rice. They compacted the rice so it was thick like a rock.  The menu selection is not great for AYCE, you have many limits on what and where you can order from. No sashimi, no soft shell crab (only in rolls), no half rolls, all the rolls are large standard size -mostly 8 pieces with the exception of some that are 5 pieces (still the same large size as the 8 pieces, just cut differently.) Not a great place if you want to try a bunch of different rolls. Even the nigiri selection was limited and overall pretty unimpressive.  Don't even think about ordering the ahi poke, seafood salad, salmon skin salad, or any of their salads for that matter. They were crazy weak in flavor/ fish/ execution. I wasn't happy with them. At all.   The only redeeming dishes were: 1. Dynamite appetizer  2. Salmon belly nigiri 3. Baked mussels  4. Green tea creme brulee And that's it...  The service we received was below average. They weren't even busy! There were 2 other tables dining besides us. We had to ask multiple times to different servers to grab us wasabi and hot sauce. Our waitress was missing, most of our dinner.  In the end, we left feeling uncomfortably stuffed due to the dense rice expanding. To top it off, it was hot and stuffy in there, and the music made my ears bleed. I agree the interior design was new, modern, beautiful, and spacious, but the overall night club vibe of the restaurant was highly disconcerting.   In a city that loves a good AYCE sushi joint, this is not the place to go. I would recommend another Korean ran spot that does a better job: Sakana.   Now, with a belly busted from rice, I bid you good luck and good evening.

D4-wYrjDLoFywJvVzzUTwA.text: First time visiting this place. Was craving sushi and this was one of the first recomendations that came up when searching online and thought I should give it a try. Atmosphere is nice, music could be better. Staff are very nice, our server Marcos was very attentive towards our needs. Definitely coming back soon.

x8jdX8PJfNORDzXBI81P0Q.text: Ah, yes. The "newer" Oyshi. Essentially the same restaurant, but bigger--yet, somehow, not -quite- as tasty as the original location!   Ambiance: 4 - The epitome of comfort: Tables that are far away from each other, enough to spread out your leg and arm span so that you won't hit another person. But still, not far away enough that you can't hear the conversations of the table next to you!   Spacious with more tables and semi-dimly lit, this Oyshi seems to have a bit more romantic lighting, if you will. Don't worry! You can still see your menu!!   Service: 5 - Our table service was fast, friendly, attentive. The restaurant wasn't busy at all, so they were really able to cater!   Food: 3 - Just like their other location, they also offer AYCE and the choice of one of their specialty desserts!   I'm usually a huge fan of their food, but the quality of the rolls were just not as good as the original location! When the taste is up to speed, most likely I'll go back, but for now, I'll drive the longer drive to the first location.  However, if you do like this location and are looking for a roll to try, I recommend the Love Affair & the dessert is -always- worth a try! Also, if you like fresh oyster, theirs is delicious :)

Oh6DAD01XTAcG2Kx2aqJCw.text: I enjoy Oyshi! Their appetizers are the stars of their all you can eat menu. Sizzling plates are where it's at! Surf and turf has the best flavors. My husband always gets the gyoza. Their sushi is fine. There's only a few rolls to "call home about". I do enjoy their nigri! Very fresh and tasty. This is definitely a spot to check out.

LcPNkq9qbPXNWgeYAZQ67A.text: If this video is any evidence, we thoroughly enjoyed the meal and more. The all you can eat is a fantastic deal and I didn't have a single roll I didn't enjoy. Sexy Roll and the Nagiri were highlights. Great find for our trip!

HwGoNGbHMzHr1zL_S-wbSQ.text: We had an excellent dinner here tonight! We were a large party of 12 and the service was excellent. Our server/waiter Mikey was especially helpful. He was fast and thorough. We had three small cranky tired children and he made sure everything came out right away for them. For those who also have younger children also know that they usually end up setting the tone for the whole meal! Haha. They were quickly happy and content with their miso soup and rice so that the rest of us could also enjoy our meal. The sushi was fantastic as well. Absolutely loved the green tea creme brulee!! Thank you again for a great meal. Definitely will be coming back again soon

zwtdKwddGNaT6yy5Eau0sA.text: So since we live around the block and were lazy we decided to give it another shot. Again sushi was ok nothing to brag about cooked food took forever to come! Waiter was horrible !  Won't be back for sure this time. I don't care how close this place is!!!!!

mPmkgrl75bBFFr9LdMhl0w.text: Hadnt been to this location yet, after I stopped going to the Rainbow location for 2 years.  Well, disappointed is all i can say. Overcooked rice, hard and dry sushi fish, overly fishy taste from uni, frozen cold amaebi fried heads... the list can go on!  You want to have a cheap $27 ayce dinner? Then this is the place.    Stay away, unless you are not picky or dont care about getting sick.

xWWeOz--vjTi7czMrkguUw.text: Pros: Tiger roll was tasty but not crunchy enough Cons: They do not offer half rolls on AYCE Dragon roll sucked Baked salmon was dry Sizzling chicken teriyaki dry & not enough teriyaki No crispy rice on menu No berries on the 'BERRY' parfait Creme brulee took forever to come out Check was presented before dessert as server had forgotten we had ordered it Slow water refills  Overall poor service and mediocre food  Will not be returning to this location

vYRWDW1zIb5An2uoRbwMzA.text: Its been awhile sinced i yelped but i feel that this experience was had to be reviewed. The outside building was charming an the inside felt cozy with a warm atmosphere. Were we greeted with a smile and told there was a wait. Then after we were seated the illusion were off an the nightmare started. Service was less to be desired an often times i was interupted with audible weird sound?? Feeling quite awkward I proceeded to order few sushi rolls and appetizers.  The shrimp tempura was not light and flaky. It tasted more like it coated with a heavy batter an was served not pipin hot but luke warm? The pink lady sushi roll look like my nephew (5yrs old) learned how to make sushi for the first time  The Pokie has three pieces of light colored Ahi Tuna with seaweed and abundance of white onion on the bottom.   Then to make matter worse 5 piece roll, coco roll, an mango roll all over sized pieces that could even fit in your mouth. The fish quality was very poor. Also tasted either salty or extremly sweet.  So i started to look around an noticed that the staff at the sushi bar; food runner who brought the food was just not in a pleasent mood.  They all seemed to give off a tired overworked type of mood. Waiter/waitress haphazardly put the plates anywhere and not clearing the table first of any dishes. My friend ordered the desert. She being brave (lol) ordered the green tea ice cream and that was overspun.   Inconclusion i had high hopes of this place especailly how inviting it seemed on the outside. Alas very disappointed and won't be dinning here anymore. Gave it 2 stars for hostess who greeted us promplty with a smile.

5GWxXCUctOu1VdMpD6mHSw.text: I took a taxi for 15minutes from encore hotel to eat sushi here. I never regret to came here. I recommend!

fNn5phgtcF5uDDcgPZDvAQ.text: This is for the all-you-can-eat lunch for $21. They make it fresh as you order and is not premade, nor is it buffet-style, which I love. A plethora of selections from hand rolls, sushi, appetizers- hot and cold, and cooked sushi ( didn't order any, personal Preference ). Uni is not included during lunch. Quality is great. I dined at the newer location which is nicely decorated with modern touches, semi-private rooms are also available. Service is good. Not a lot of people for lunch on a weekday but maybe because it's at the new location. Would come back here!

V3NuU835b9Uh3891B7ZMaA.text: Sushi, Sake & Fun! This place is great! Fish is so 'ono  I've been here multiple times and the service is always great! Definitely come and check this place out if you haven't!

kLoX-bOU5JFM6iF6tjU-GQ.text: This place is right down the street from my house so I have been here several times. I usually sit at the bar as it is quiet and I enjoy watching them make the rolls. The wait staff is friendly and quite quick, however I notice that when it gets busy some orders are forgotten about, needing to re-submit them. But alas, the food is very good, and being so close, I will definitely come back many more times.

Vn4IRbIt3x06_xEalvFIWw.text: IN THEIR DEFENSE, it is Christmas Eve. That is my only disclaimer. The service we received was horrendous and there is nobody to blame except the owner because evidently she was also our server. I understand it is a busy holiday evening. However, we called prior to arriving and asked if they were  busy amd whether we needed to make a reservation. We were assured that they were not busy and we could just walk in. Once we arrived, we were informed that they were tremendously busy and we must wait at the bar. We proceeded to sit next to a minor and her father at the bar (which specifically states nobody under 21 is allowed.) Thereafter, once we were seated and orders placed, we were ignored- plates never cleared (AYCE) and water not filled, despite us asking. The mere reason for giving 3 STARS is due to the Sushi Counter chef, Pedro, whom made an otherwise disappointing experience tolerable.  We will contunue to visit the Rainbow location. Merry Christmas.

ro4Yk0Ddh_R0DaAV1ez2LA.text: Oyshi sushi definitely never under estimates my pallet! It continues to satisfy my need for phenomenal food as well as service! If you have never tired you are definitely missing out! The menus are overflowing with creativity as well as product that you will not get anywhere else in Vegas! Luckily they have two location however the Oyshi sushi on Sahara definitely had my heart! Thank you for never letting me down Oyshi Sushi!!! Thank you also for all your hard work and dedication!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyshi Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The calm before the storm!

uO0xeXoqC1qAP26Ez6Adrg.text: We came here at 9 pm on a Sunday for dinner. The restaurant was not busy, we were sat fairly quickly. Our waiter waited until our entire party was present before checking to see if we wanted to order. By the time we ordered and food was starting to come out, we were told that it was last call at 9:45 (they close at 10:30). I fm felt rushed and pressure to order more food to make sure I got my money's worth for AYCE. The rest of our food including dessert came out and by 10:15 the staff was mopping and cleaning around us. There were still at least 6 tables still eating while employees were rushing around trying to close up for the night.   I find this extremely unprofessional and terrible for service. Even though the food was good, I felt that I didn't enjoy it because I felt rushed. It was pretty clear that the patrons were being kicked out, the closer it got to 10:30, the more unwelcome I felt.   This location gets 2 stars only because the food is good but the service is horrendous.

3_Hj0cDM0YmvoMlJxpSRcA.text: Had a mini reunion of friends and chose Oishi Sushi. Gave it 4 stars because of customer service!  Our little waitress was amazing & all the gals & 1 male server there, for that matter!   Food was pretty good...but customer service brought it to 4 stars & I never rate 5 stars!

03UYxVgDdTXbq-Q-MojIuA.text: Very bad service! And place was empty! I ordered the tiger roll which by the way is great at the other location! First of all i think the server forgot about it because everybody in my party got their food, when i asked about mine she said she would ck and 5 mins later it came! Really not worth the wait, had to eat it because i was starbing, ordered tea and asked for sugar again server never brought it or refills, sad to see a beautiful place go, ladies bathroom was disgusting too! Would not recommend this location at all

Our server, Ryan did a fantastic job so we did not hurt with full bellies!

APKhtrwMgX-Eydo4HrzhSw.text: How can you beat AYCE sushi for $27?  Had dinner here last night. Sat at the bar and had great service. enjoyed chatting with the chefs and watching the sushi be made.  Service is great, prices are reasonable.  Couldn't ask for more.

tQHDtNrHSp2nMrP36RtcgQ.text: If you work late or decide to crave sushi last minute, I highly suggest you DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION. The Sahara location has a tendency to close over an hour before their closing time. This has happened to me on 3/3 occasions when I've arrived there around 9:45pm (even though their closing time is 11pm on weekdays). I'll walk in, then they'll tell me they're already cleaning so we can't eat there. Just avoid this hassle and go straight to the Rainbow location. The food there is the same and the staff at the Rainbow location is excellent!!

5yWMOmw1PXffsRDWEFb_Vg.text: Food was great. Service wasn't good at all. Drinks never filled and food runner checked on us more than our server ever did.

r7RxNtGSkgaA-08uxnlwoQ.text: It was my first time here and the food was pretty great and the service was awesome definitely recommend it to anyone who is a sushi lover definitely is the spot come and have some good sushi

iDYY5gQWI0ZOgRxbgMkOVw.text: This place is my favorite AYCE Sushi in Las Vegas. The quality of fish and the execution is excellent and always consistent. I go there for the Hamachi and fresh Scallop Nigiri and the Nuclear Bomb specialty roll. This is a great place for small or large groups, business or casual. This place is great for lunch, but dinner is where they shine. Check out the items exclusive to dinner only, all are excellent!

0ucwDW2YcUP8UYdj_tQm9g.text: Favorite Location even though I live closer to the location. Great fast service! With Awesome friendly staff! Last but But Not Least the Best Sushi Ever!!!!!

1uKiB8IGqoKaH4U81D_qhQ.text: Bomb ass sushi and a great menu selection. The all you can eat allows you to try many different items. I enjoyed it and will be back.

siRa5v3lThR907vX2Ay-rg.text: This is hands down my boyfriend & I's favorite place to get sushi! We come here a lot (probably more often than excusable) and have never been disappointed. Not once. A lot of the reason we come is the atmosphere, though trust me the food is no disappointment AT ALL. Every time we come it feels like being around family. The people here are so personable, they do so well with choosing staff. I've never been treated any less than kind, no matter the flow of traffic. The AYCE is very well priced for the food you receive and it's easy to get caught up indulging with the amazing items to choose from. Each of the chefs here are magicians in their own right, Sam and Leo are great, but Ed is by far our go to guy! Where ever you find Nacho he's always fun & look for the name tag "Golden", I think he's the first person we grew fond of when we began coming here! I always recommend Oyshi when people are looking for a place to eat sushi and I don't plan on finding another one as long as we're in Vegas.

Considering I live on the other side of town & there are sushi restaurants that are closer to me that I like better I probably won't be back to Oyshi. TPPJoeRf2UlHl0RzjbMR2w.text: If you don't like Oyshi sushi, then you're probably a Communist who hates freedom and puppies. It's just that simple.  There aren't many good ayce establishments in Las Vegas,  however Oyshi on Sahara stands out as a rarity. The fish is unusually fresh for ayce, the fusion rolls extremely creative, and the sushi chefs - starring Chefs Daniel, Pedro, and Curtis - are awesome guys that know what they're doing (they also have a sense of humor). Additonally, the servers have all been very friendly and everyone makes you feel really welcome.  This is the only ayce sushi restaurant I go to in Las Vegas. Give 'em a try. If you don't - or if you don't like it - then I hope you can rest at night, comfortable in the knowledge that you are everything that is wrong with America.

QwymQtR1uSUQv2YueqPa4w.text: Sushi bar is amazing! This is my families go to sushi bar. Seafood is always fresh and sushi chefs/ waiters are amazing. Service is kinda slow on weekends, but not too bad. Never had any major problems at this restaurant so I encourage everyone to try it out.

A98-Kd0VsFeRHS3q9q-I7A.text: Everything was delicious. Clean and staff are super helpful and awesome. Their double screaming roll stupidly awesome, along with their tasty deserts like green tea creme brulee. Its a must go to for the best sushi in Vegas!!

I'll be sure to try them next time. We got to see Nyi again.  I think he actually remembers us although we haven't seen him in years.  This location is a little far from us but we'll be back for sure when we're in the neighborhood.  Otherwise we'll be at the Rainbow location bugging Ryan and Justin.  Ha ha!!!

Once the waiter got there, he was pleasant and attended to the table. Fresh selection of fish and very creative rolls. I would dine there again.

I will definitely be coming back. Never heard of this place ever . But everything was delicious. Great customer service and fast service

For two girls to eat 5 rolls of sushi for all you can eat took two hours. The all you can eat price is way too high for the service and quality of food.

5dBsgFy70gQukHDuWG36MQ.text: I'm really unsure if I should write this review or not but I'm a stickler for customer serivce. We went to have dinner last night 1/9 and the place was packed. The entrance way was so busy we have swim the thru the ppl who refused to make rm, walked up to the hostess counter... a waitress was scrambling around and didn't even acknowledge us! She was walked away and continued on with her shift... next the hostess steps in, grabs menus and walks off to the sea off ppl to seat them... all the while no one has said a word to our party. Then when she finally decides to grace us with her conversation she says it's an hour plus wait... no thanks... so my take on the food is I won't be eating it

1f2Tk3tcGJxG9qxmskmkxA.text: Atmosphere is nice. Umbrella lights were my wife's favorite part aside from the tree rooms. Sushi is good. Service is friendly.

hyFxGENCiW8E7uIuPeJupA.text: Really cool vibe, our server Golden was amazing brought everything out in a timely manner. I'd definitely recommend this place for group outings!

swEGCsYHfFRaB_OV4k7mJw.text: The restaurant is styled really cool, it has a few different styles but not too much going on. While having an open floor plan but still having your privacy In-between each table. Our waiter was awesome and super laid back. We got along right off the bat and he was able to tell the bartender to make a whiskey sour although It wasn't on the drink menu. The waiters name is Kenny, he was really understanding after the over servers brought out the wrong food, and forgot to bring out some of the rolls we ordered. He was willing to not include it on the bill on his behalf, with no questions or hassle making us feel really relieved that we didn't have to try and finish these extra rolls that we didn't like nor order. Don't get me wrong the food is amazing, but there are some things I'm not interested in but every time I come I'm never disappointed in what I order.

JyzAIUPBAB_GIjQJ_eYZuA.text: Date night! First time at the Sahara location which is so much closer to us. Love it.

mdQIFUw-VOQj4R3Fe8qnMg.text: Oyshi is the best sushi in Las Vegas! Their happy hour is hard to beat ! For all real sushi lovers around the world, Oyshi is the place to visit . I would strongly recommend Ginza , Dragon and Monster rolls . Thank me later *drizzy :)

-bGib7NgazWPF8_Ox3_Xqw.text: I love the thick slices of fish. Everything here is great from the rolls down to the salad. The croquettes are amazing.

fAFGPWopK0zTOUZGNDHHtg.text: Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice? Shame on me.  I won't be back.  Love the atmosphere of this place. Has a good bar, neat little lounge area,and the sushi is decent for the price.  But I don't know if the service can be any slower. First time,restaurant half empty, took us (4 people) 30 minutes to get our first round of sushi.  After that the waitress disappeared and we didn't order the second round for another 20.  Last night there were two of us at the bar, again, the restaurant was 3/4th full.  First round of sushi came out fairly quickly, however our server Mono disappeared time after time as we sat there with no food, or empty glasses.  Lousy.  I guess it's my fault for thinking a second chance was needed.  Taking my business elsewhere.
